Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: Karen H
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here three times now. We get the ocean front efficiency, with a balcony that overlooks the ocean. The room is always clean. The kitchen efficiency is small, but it has a decent size refrigerator, a small oven/stove, a microwave and a coffee maker. There is a sitting area, with a table and four chairs and a couch. The balcony has two plastic chairs and a plastic table. It's not fancy, but it's all we need. If luxury is important to you, don't stay here though. It's clean but simple. We'll be back next year. Also, it's right at the beginning of the boardwalk. You can take the tram up and down the boardwalk and it's right next to the hotel. We love the convenience of that. It's on the boardwalk but not the part that's noisy. We are rarely bothered by noise at night we we sometimes leave the windows open.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Restless87
Reviews.Content: We found the Dunes Manor to be a nice hotel. It could use friendlier staff; when we checked in after a very long drive, we could have been made to feel a little more welcome at the front desk. We also feel that the rooms could use another table to help keep your stuff off the floor; there is only one table and we had to cram everything on it. We are fanatics about bed bugs and totally took the beds apart upon arrival and found no signs. We have over 20 years in the hospitality industry ourselves and we would stay here again. It does seem to cater to an older crowd, but that's OK with us. The location away from the noise of the boardwalk is great; yet you are close enough to walk or catch the bus. Could the hotel be cleaner? Yes, but show me a hotel that's 100% clean anywhere. Work on training your front desk in hospitality, clean up a little more, and you'll be fine Dunes Manor. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “NICE, BUT NOT GREAT”
Reviews.Author: Boggie62
Reviews.Content: We checked in over Labor Day weekend for 2 nights. We arrived early for check in and sat on the nice porch overlooking the ocean in rocking chairs. When it came time to check in, there was nary a cart or a bellman around. When I asked at the desk, they told us to wait for the bellman. We waited for 15 minutes and then he came and helped us. I think they need more carts, or more bellmen. The room was nice with a balcony overlooking the ocean. The beds were great and the linens adequate. It seemed clean. At night, the place was quiet. We only had dessert in the restaurant which was nothing special. Parking was close. All in all, I think we might return for a visit, although I don't think it was any bargain.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “"Dunes Dump"”
Reviews.Author: Marlene D
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Ocean city for over 30 years and always thought the Dunes Manor was the shxx! So in July of 2012 I decided to stay there for 2 nights with my 3 daughters and my Grandson. To sum up my weekend getaway.. the room was very dirty I mean VERY DIRTY.. food under the bed, hairs left on the bathroom floor and spots and stains everywhere, including the sheets and towels!! The AC worked 50% of the time we were there. I only complained once about the AC and supposedly someone came up and fixed it. Like I said, it worked 50% of the time. The staff was extremely rude so my daughters and I decided not to complain about anything to them (other than the AC not working). I noticed on the 2nd day we were ther my poor 2 yr old g-son broke out in a rash?? I wouldnt be surprised if there were BED bugs in the room. The pool was very very small for such a big Hotel! As I mentioned this is a place Ive always wanted to stay and was EXTREMELY disappointed with my overall experience!! The restaurant was over priced and the food sucked. Oh, Did I mention I paid almost $600 for 2 nights for this dump??? If you are all wondering why I didnt complain is because I would rather get on every site there is to give this hotel a BAD reveiw and thats how I will get my satisfaction! If they gave me a free room for a week I WOULD TURN IT DOWN!! DIRY FILTHY DUMP IS ALL THE DUNES MAOR IS!! Beware folks, the pics are deceiving! I have already told all my friends and family about this dump and hopefully Management will get the hint and do something about it!! A motel 6 is probably cleaner than the "Dunes Dump"

Reviews.Title: “Dunes not worth it! To old, need to invest in updating!! Room had too many things wrong, staff unfriendly.”
Reviews.Author: Rosey60763
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week at the Dunes. Wouldn't go back. Needs major updating. Style is supposed to be Victorian but looks old like they havent changed anything since they opened in 1986. Things wrong with room, electrical socket didn't work for charging devices, toilet barely flushed, lock on back door didn't work. All these add up to we won't be back. Other cons: TV is from 1986...doesn't even swivel out of cabinet so you can see it from far bed.....believe me dunes nobody is steeling that TV they don't even make those anymore!!!! Cleanliness questionable...my socks were filthy from walking around the room. Sing a long at night made me fell like I was in a nursing home.....much older population not for young families seem to cater to elderly. Lastly, no one was nice!!! Staff was just not friendly. View not worth it with all these other issues..u can find the same view at a more modern hotel in OC!!! Boardwalk a block away but still very long walk to get to shops/resturants on boardwalk u have to drive anyway. Next summer will stick closer to home and go back to NJ shore where everyone is much more friendly!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Tea and Crumpets”
Reviews.Author: DooWopPop
Reviews.Content: Everything you need for a long weekend is.at The Dunes. Hop,skip & jump to beach, all ocean front rooms,and short walk to boardwalk (2blocks). Not everyone's cup of tea with singalongs to "You Are My Sunshine" in evening and 3:00 Tea $ crumpets but if it keeps out riffraff I'll sail on that cruise ship. One thing to improve is WIFI connection which barely worked even in lobby. If you're looking for quiet spot on beach near epicenter and not taking your business work or study along, look no farther.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accomodation”
Reviews.Author: AgnesFA
Reviews.Content: I love the view of this hotel! It was a last minute booking for I could not find any other hotel that is ocean view and It was nice. Also, is just steps away from the boardwalk. I love the free afternoon tea with cookies and free popcorn in the afternoon and watch the beach by their balcony. Although the room, is outdated and really small for a hotel this price. But hotel staff are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Creepy Staff Person”
Reviews.Author: TarH50
Reviews.Content: Stayed here August 22nd to 26th. When we arrived, we parked in the underground parking garage, in a handicapped spot, hung the tag in the window, creepy staff guy appeared from no where, peered at the tag and actually asked if I had a handicap, in a rude manner. He continued to appear everywhere we were during our stay, including outside our room while the cleaning person was there. We did report to the Front Desk on the first day said they would take care of it, continued to happen. Every time he passed us, he would make rude noises. Since we were 2 women traveling together, this was disconcerting and it appeared as if he were stalking us. Other than that, the hotel was nice, clean and had everything we needed. Hotel is older, beds were comfortable and clean, housekeeping and maintenance staff were responsive to requests. All rooms are ocean front. Due to the storms, we ate at the restaurant in the lobby the last night we were there. It was one of the best meals we had, I had the filet and my sister had the crab cake, excellent food, attentive wait staff, I would highly recommend it! The piano entertainment in the lobby is a lot of fun, requests are honored and singing along is encouraged!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME VACATION, PERFECT HOTEL LOCATION!!!”
Reviews.Author: NYCMommyof2
Reviews.Content: This is the second time my family has chosen to stay at the Dunes Hotel and again we were not disappointed. This hotel is located right on the beach and at the end of the OC boardwalk (28th st.). You get amazing views from your balcony, sunrise,sunsets, views of the beach and the occasional dolphin too. Within steps of the hotel is the tram that travels up and down the OC boardwalk and a bike rental kiosk. The location of this hotel is perfect, on the beach and close to all the action. Rooms are clean, staff is helpful and friendly. Will definetly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Always an enjoyable stay at the Dunes”
Reviews.Author: OC-gotopro
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Dunes a handful of times and have always enjoyed the experience. Never a dirty room. Never a missing item from the room. Never a rude staff member. Never a billing issue. I will continue to choose this hotel as long as those things do not change. My most recent stay was August 2012 with four generations of women in my family, ranging in age from 3 to 73. We all enjoyed ourselves and made nice with all of the staff members and guests we encountered. You must do breakfast in the restaurant here at least one day of your stay, it's better than many places in OC and you will not have to wait! My favorite part about the Dunes is the oversized porch and rocking chairs. I could sleep out there, it's just that relaxing. Also, you're right on the edge of the boardwalk...close in proximity but far from the noise! **NOTE: If you check out on a Saturday or Sunday, be prepared to wait a good 10mins for an elevator.

Reviews.Title: “ANOTHER GREAT VACATION”
Reviews.Author: TB610
Reviews.Content: My family and I vacationed in Ocean City, MD for the second year in a row and our vacation choice again was Dunes Manor Motel. Once again the motel portion of this property did not disappoint. Last year we stayed at one of the pool side rooms. It was very nice however too small for a family of four. We upgraded this year to a one room efficiency. There were two double beds and a pull out. We had a refrigerator, stove, microwave and balcony. It was plenty of space and very nice. The staff once again was very courteous and kept our room cleaned as we needed. The location for this property is great. Your are right on the boardwalk ..close enough to walk or take the tram to the "action" but not in the middle of it. You have the best of both worlds. We will definitely return. Next year we may try the rooms on the lower level with your very own patio and walk right out onto the beach. Stay tuned............

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Rooms Need Some Updating”
Reviews.Author: ectraveller12
Reviews.Content: The location of the Dunes Manor is great -- at the end of the Boardwalk and right on the beach. Barefoot bar was nice for lunch and drinks and porch is lovely. Our TV died the first morning we were there and it was replaced quickly. Beds are okay but not great and pillows were small and not very comfortable. Defiinitely could use some updating Stayed for a weekend with 2 adults and 2 kids and wanted a place right on the beach. Since we didn't spend much time in the room it was okay. But I still waiting to find a nice hotel on the beach in Ocean City that isn't outrageously expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Resteraunt not good, hotel atmosphere was historical”
Reviews.Author: kody76
Reviews.Content: We came here to eat and left hungry, even my 8year old niece was hungry and wanted to eat her dads pancakes. Nothing special and not a great place for a beach breakfast. Used to awesome places in New Jersey, tbis was recommended by a local it was not worth the price or wait

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Abigail F
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Ocean City, MD with my family (husband, 4 yr old and 1 yr old). We stayed for 3 nights at the Dunes Manor Hotel and were, for the most part, pleased with our stay. We arrived at 3:30pm and our room was ready. However, we did not feel welcomed by the rather curt woman behind the desk. She is in hospitality but it did not feel like it. Our room was plenty large for our family, including a pack n play for the baby. The TV could use some updating, the fridge was ice cold (literally, it froze our fruit), the coverlets were typical cheesy hotel type, and the lighting was adequate. The bathroom was clean, the towels fairly soft, and the vanity area was a bit on the small side. It was outside the bathroom across from a fridge, microwave and small coffee maker. The balcony was nice with white resin chairs and table. Some of the staff was very nice and accommodating. My husband was very miffed when given an attitude by a staff person that he asked about where to buy milk for the baby. Overall, the hotel was fine. It was located just at the end of the boardwalk. It was a healthy walk to the other end. We liked that it was quiet. It is across the street from Jolly Roger Amusement park/mini golf. Around the corner from the Fractured Prune for the most delicious donuts ever. 2 Blocks from Happy Jack for yummy pancake breakfast. Pool was kind of small and was indoor/outdoor. They closed it at first rumble of thunder so we didn't get too much time in--water was freezing. Great beachside bar with nice bartenders. We were there during a big thunderstorm and were stuck in the room with my sleeping baby. Housekeeping called to see if we needed anything and said they'd be there at 4:30 to make up the room. The housekeeper was very nice and indeed, came back to make up the room. We would probably stay there again--just will probably wait until kids get a little older to go back to Ocean City. Oh and we ate breakfast there in the Victorian Room--food was decent but we were annoyed by the presence of several little flies. The server, Alex, was a very sweet guy that paid a lot of attention to my kids.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be much better. Going down hill.”
Reviews.Author: Joanne T
Reviews.Content: My huband, son and I have spent many vacations at Dunes Manor Hotel. We always loved it. Unfortunately, things have changed since the original owner has passed on. She was a lovely woman who wanted every detail tended to. She would even greet guests during the daily Tea Time. Well, now she must be rolling over in her grave. Our last stay there was summer 2011 and was a huge disappointment. Room was not clean and in desperate need of repairs in the shower and bathroom. Room looked dingey as did other areas of the hotel. Furiture looked old and dingey. People who are giving it good reviews probably did not stay there in it's hay day. It used to be so much nicer and the staff used to be wonderful. The staff last summer was either rude or appeared uninterested in their jobs. I had a friend who also stayed there last summer and she agreed that the hotel is definitely in need of a good cleaning and new management. She had also stayed there when the owner was alive and agreed that things have really been let go. What a shame! I used to really love going there. Won't go back since I like a clean room. The location is great, the back porch is wonderful, but the rest is deteriorating. Managment, wake up! Bring this wonderful hotel back to it's original grandeur! Shame on you for ruining the original owner's dream. She wanted that hotel to represent the finest of everything. She wanted guests to be treated like guests. We had to leave our visit early due to an impending hurricane. We were not even notified that the hotel was asking people to vacate because of the storm. We found out this information quite by accident from another guest. The front desk insisted that they left us a voicemail, and treated me very rudely when I politely told them that there was no voicemail on my phone. They were not the least bit helpful and made me feel as though I was bothering them. I won't stay there again. These people need new management, manners, an attitude adjustment and some lessons in cleanliness. Does anyone know of a great place to stay in OC? Joanne T. from Binghamton, NY

Reviews.Title: “Water Water Everywhere But Not a Drop to Drink”
Reviews.Author: Kristen J
Reviews.Content: Everything others are saying is true: the hotel is old, the TV hasn't been updated since 1993, and the AC's off or on settings were annoying. I'm used to air conditioning that kicks on when it needs to cool the room, not runs until you manually turn it off. However, I'd like to add my biggest complaint: THERE WAS NO WATER IN THIS HOTEL. Sure, there are plenty of vending machines that claim they sell water, but they were all sold out, several ate my money, and when I went to the front desk to complain, she refunded my money (after I completed a form) and suggested I either enjoy the tiny cups of ice water available in the lobby OR walk to the 7-11 several blocks away and buy my own. It's summer and I'm pregnant, which means I drink about 80+ ounces of water EACH DAY, and refilling my 6 ounce cup in the lobby was not going to cut it. She was "nice" enough to negotiate the rate of the bartender's supply from $2.95 to $1.50 (which is still HIGHER than the vending machines I was willing to purchase from had any of them worked). I felt she should have given me at least 1 complimentary bottle of water for my troubles, but apparently that cost wasn't built in to the $260 per night we paid for the room.

Reviews.Title: “A bit old yet good and clean”
Reviews.Author: travelbugOttawa_On
Reviews.Content: Ocean City reminds me of Jasper Canada during peak season. Most acceptable hotels or motels are fully booked therefore getting a room a day before arrival is such a gift. There was nothing that surprised me @Dunes. I read through the TA reports and as usual they were spot on. So, I wasn't turned off by the age of the hotel. Some people wrote about it being untidy but I found the opposite. It felt like going to grandma's home. OLD edifice that would surely benefit updating. But, it was definitely clean. Walls have been repainted and our room and other public areas were well sanitized. With that said, I really think the management should think about renovating the building, updating in-room amenities (not that we cared for it since we were at the beach most of the time). Our likes: 1. It's situated 2 blocks off the starting point of the boardwalk. If you want peace & quiet, this would be a plus. 2. Their main dining room "The Victorian Room by the Sea" serves good breakfasts (lump crabmeat omelet, yum!) and reminds me of "Somewhere in Time" for those of you old enough to remember Christopher Reeve and Jane Seymore :) 3. The deck is a good place to hang out if you don't want to be on the sand. Our dislikes: 1. Again, although it was clean, it really needs a major renovation. 2. DH, noted that since it wasn't on the boardwalk beachcombers didn't pass through everyday. The sand would have benefitted from it. 3. The least expensive food outlets for a quick bite i.e. fish tacos, coffee outlets, etc. where located mid-boardwalk so you either had to walk or take the tram ($3/each way) to get to those. Overall, since this was only a short stay, we enjoyed it and were satisfied with our pick. We'd recommend it to friends who travel the same we do.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful all around”
Reviews.Author: Combatvet101
Reviews.Content: The Dunes manor hotel is a wonderful place to stay. Very clean hotel. The staff are very friendly and always smiling and ready to answer your questions. The bathrooms in the lobby area are extremely clean and smell very nice unlike other hotels. The staff are constantly maintaining it's appearence. The view of the beach is very beautiful. The atmosphere is very family oriented. My wife and i are going to make the dunes manor hotel our spot to come back to every year and we will be recommending the hotel to everyone we know. To the owners or managers whatever you are doing, keep doing it cause your doing a great job. I rate this as a perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service ever”
Reviews.Author: Yolo21
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying Linda the assistant manager and louane or however you spell her name she works overnight. They were the most rudest people i've ever had to deal with and racist at that. Linda sold our room that we booked two weeks ahead of time and tried to put us in a double bed room instead of the suite which we had originally booked.. she insisted that we didnt know what we were talking about and that she would gladly put us in the motel. She claimed the person who booked our room had worked there for 10 years and that she would never make a mistake she kept yelling at us as if we were idiots and we had our information that was given to us over the phone. She put us in a room where they put people who had been injured in a boat accident and had no where to stay "charity" room. Later that night the front desk lady louanne claimed she had better stuff to do then help me get my parking ticket ...do you think she helped and gave me one NO instead she yelled at me while an employee sat there along with her. I do not recommend this hotel to ANYONE! There racist, rude and dont give a damn about any customer whos a minority. Linda should be fired along with louanne. The room was sooo ugly and dirty! If you want a peaceful vacation STAY AWAY FROM THE DUNES HOTEL...

Reviews.Title: “First time”
Reviews.Author: Cindy S
Reviews.Content: I've been visiting OC annually for 35 years. This was my first stay at Dunes Manor, but wont be my last. The staff went out of their way to make you feel welcome. We needed a middle of the bed change-sick child- and the front desk was quick to get us new linens. The next day our housekeeper, Mildred, was unable to get to our room due to our early return from the beach. She made sure we had everything we needed in the interim until the evening cleaning crew arrived. Our room was serviced when we returned from dinner. Mildred followed up the next morning to make sure we were taken care of the previous night. I appreciated her gesture. The room was clean and perfect for a 3 day beach visit. The complimentary coffee in the morning and iced tea in the afternoon were a very nice conveniece. The mini fridge was helpful in keeping the Candy Kitchen chocolates in tact. Thank you for a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: mikep06
Reviews.Content: I have been in many hotels in Ocean city over the years and the Dunes Manor Hotel is on top of that list. The parking was plentiful, in front of the hotel and two more spots on the sides. Check in was easy and fast. We were traveling with a 9 month old, so the condition and the location of the hotel is very important to us. The rooms were good and the balcony overlooking the ocean was great. The location of the hotel was 2 blocks from the boardwalk, so the noise levels were down, yet the location was prime. The hotel staff were also very accommodating for the last check out due to the baby naps, we could check out a bit later without any fees, which was great. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to everyone from family to singles as well.

Reviews.Title: “Beds are awful!”
Reviews.Author: Travelingdad38
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind HARD beds and being policed this is your place. It looks nice from the outside and has a Fantastic deck but the lobby reminds me of a funeral home inside. NEGATIVES: 1. BEDS are super HARD. Where we could not sleep and that is importantt to me. 2. They will not let you bring drinks in. 3. They police the pool and make you feel uncomfortable. It not like it's a nice pool and outsiders would try to break in and swim! 4. Don't feel welcome even though there is a bellboy at the door. 5. The pool area 6. Exercise room - not much there POSITIVES: 1. Fantastic location 2. They have happy hour every day and the bar staff is wonderful and friendly. 3. It is a very quiet hotel because all the policing they do. 4. Great if you're over 60 and don't mind hard beds. 5. Rooms are clean 6. Happy hour 7. Dining 8. Nice deck Over looking the ocean My final Thought is this hotel is nice if you don't have kids or if you are the quiet (boring)type and don't like activities. They do offer a few different dining options and happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Average”
Reviews.Author: MarkandDanielle05
Reviews.Content: Located on the beach the Dunes Manor Hotel's "ocean view" rooms (a premium accommodation) is no different than any other balcony ocean view - absolutely wonderful! This almost makes up for the dated accommodations that include low thread count bed sheets (sand papery feel made worst with sunburn) on very firm beds with standard foam pillows. Modest furnishings are anything but refined to include a tube TV to round out the features. Disappointing considering the premium rate. Despite this the room and bathroom were clean as they should be. DMH is also located at the end of the boardwalk which eliminates the heavy crowds. Beach access is a snap. Hungry for lunch or a cool beverage? A beach-side bar/cafe is conveniently located at the base of the hotel. In all, the accommodations were adequate at best and staff friendly and helpful. Pool and restaurant are also provided. However, with all there is to see and do and eat in Ocean City why bother?

Reviews.Title: “great but could use some updating”
Reviews.Author: travelrag
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel for two nights. The hotel is at the begining of the Boardwalk but is very quiet. All rooms are oceanfront with great views, wonderful for sleeping to the sound of the waves. The rooms are a nice size and clean but could use with a bit of updating. There is some rust around the the door frames and could use new fixtures in the bathroom,And a flat screen tv would be nice. The large veranda with rocking chairs is a great place to enjoy the complimentary tea and crumpets. The staff was very accomadating by granting us an early check in and a late checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Brian R
Reviews.Content: Myself and my family stayed here for two nights July 3rd and 4th, and this was our first time here. We arrived at noon, and were allowed to check in early (normal time is 3pm). Ocean front view was gorgeous, especially at night. Rooms were very clean, pool/hottub were clean and well maintained. I didn't have too much interaction with staff, but the times I did, they were courteous, professional, and went out of their way to make you feel at home. Location is great being on 28th street, right near the beginning of the boardwalk, and within walking distance to food, dining, Jolly Roger Amusement park, and Old Pro Mini Golf (Medievel themed). In short, the place was great, and we're already planning next year's trip, hopefully a longer one!

Reviews.Title: “nice accomadations, nice people to deal with”
Reviews.Author: phenneger
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nites on the spur of the moment, pool was very nice personnel were very niceand helpful, room clean and well maintained

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Oceanfront Hotel”
Reviews.Author: STK1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to Ocean City, Md. at least 3 times a year, and do so over the course of all seasons. We have been staying at the Dunes Manor Hotel on our extended weekend trips for many, many years and would not even consider another. This Victorian style Hotel is clean, well kept, has all oceanfront rooms with wonderful views, has a nice restaurant and lounge, indoor/outdoor pool, huge deck to sit and relax and tea and cookies are served in the afternoon. Rooms are basic, clean and comfortable. Management and staff are friendly and efficient. Priced accordingly by season but the Off-Season rates cannot be beat for the accommodations and location. Would highly reccommend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer W
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Ocean City, and we chose Dunes Manor Hotel based on location and the oceanfront rooms. We wanted a hotel that was close to everything but not directly on the boardwalk to avoid nightly noise. This hotel was perfect! Only a block from the end of the boardwalk and perfectly quiet at night. We left the windows open at night and fell asleep to the sound of crashing waves. We woke up to spectacular sunrises and the sight of dolphins in the water. The rooms were clean. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The complimentary tea and cookies was lovely. The only negatives I can think of are the pool and Wi-Fi. While the pool is perfect if the weather is nice, because it is an indoor/outdoor pool, the Hotel closes it at the sound of thunder. So if the weather stinks, you won't be hanging out on the beach or at their pool. Also, while they have free Wi-Fi, we stayed in a corner room, which was out of range. We didn't mind though. Overall, we loved our stay and will definitely stay at Dunes Manor Hotel when we return to Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed...”
Reviews.Author: ChatsMcGee
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an extended weekend trip to the Dunes Manor. The last time I was there was about 20 years ago and it exceeded my expectations. Clean rooms, friendly staff and a perfect Ocean Front location. We stayed in the Trappe Suite (a 2 bedroom efficiency with a full kitchen, seating area and pull out sofabed). Kitchen area was nice. Didn't use the oven or stovetop, but it had a full fridge, small microwave and a double (small) sink - with VERY hot water. There were 4 adults and our 14month old staying in the room. The extra sitting/kitchen room was great for the little one to run around in and play. The only thing the room was missing was a full length mirror. My one complaint was that we showed up at noon and were told that check-in was at 3pm. The woman at the front desk knew that we had an infant with us and said that they would try to get us into the room early, and would call us when the room was ready. We sat out on the balcony overlooking the ocean and had some lunch. We received no call from the desk, so we went in and sat in a sitting area across from the check-in (around 2pm). Knowing that we had a restless baby you would think that they would do something to expedite the room for us. Nope. They called us over AFTER 3pm and told us that the room was finally ready. They should accommodate for early check-in on a reservation system. If you plan on showing up before the 3pm check-in, prepare to wait. Aside from the check-in debacle, we will be returning to the Dunes on our next trip to OC.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Krista M
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Dunes Manor. Unfortunaly it was only for a weekend so we didnt get to use a lot of the ammenities that they offered. The hotel was very nice. Amazing location close to everything. The view from our balcony was beautiful. The hotel was very clean. We have been going to ocean city for years and have never stayed in a hotel that was as clean as this one for a decent price. If your on a budget and want clean this is the place to go. The only thing that we didn't like was that there were so many rules. Everywhere you looked there was a role posted on the wall. Or in a book. You werent aloud to walk in the lobby while in a bathing suite. Considering it's an ocean front hotel with the pool on the same floor as the lobby i think that role is a bit unrealistic. Also, the door to get to the beach from the ground level of the hotel was not marked so we had to ask where the beach access door was. We would definatly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “3.5star”
Reviews.Author: sthain2012
Reviews.Content: Stayed over past weekend. Over all good. Front clean and well maintained. Restaurant very good quality dinner.iano performance n lobby is great. Rooms are ok. Clean but basic. Tv outdated. Toiletries very basic. Towels poor quality. But to their credit, there were more than enough number of of towels of all sizes. We may not mind staying again. Overall 3.5 . The best part is the staff, all very good, friendly, helpful and efficient, rate 4.5

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Julie F
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed in this hotel four times, including June 12-15, 2012, and enjoyed it every time. I like how it is peaceful and quiet, close enough to the boardwalk to walk to but far enough away that you aren't bothered. It was senior week when we stayed, so I was glad to not be around the drinking and noise... that's really not my scene. The oceanfront rooms are great and include a balcony. The lobby is beautiful and the staff friendly. Housekeeping did a very nice job while we were there. We will continue staying every time we come to Ocean City. I am very glad that the rooms have free wireless access, refrigerator, and microwave. I did not eat at the hotel restaurant/bar; there are a number of good places nearby, including Philips and Higgins.

Reviews.Title: “We got our deposit back.”
Reviews.Author: debrameg
Reviews.Content: We had to cancel our visit unfortunately due to illness. The staff was so nice that they refunded my mother's deposit with less than a 24 hours notice.We hope to stay there sometime in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as last year.”
Reviews.Author: Levy799
Reviews.Content: While we can afford the more expensive hotels like Hilton and Holiday Inn (stayed in both and they're great for OC standards) we chose the Dunes Manor last year while staying for my daughter's soccer tournament. Although the rooms weren't the best, the breakfast, service, and location made up for it. The breakfast at the hotel isn't nearly as good and I'm pretty sure they've changed their coffee. Raw greasy eggs, mushy hash browns, poor service this year when having breakfast. The worst part of the stay and the reason I won't stay here again is the bed. I remember the bed being uncomfortable last year but bearable. This year, the bed was unbearable. So hard I've had to live on Motrin the past three days because I wake up in so much pain and I'm only 36 and in good health and shape! We only come to OC for my daughter's sand soccer tournament so next year, we'll be at the Hilton or Holiday Inn. There are still some nice things about the Dunes such as the piano in the lobby, which is played nightly and sing alongs are encouraged. Not my scene but good for older folks. Also, be advised there aren't any weights in the fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Time to spruce up!”
Reviews.Author: MackSandy
Reviews.Content: We've loved the Dunes for a long time. Its location, balconies, ocean views are all excellent. But, Mr. Dunes, it's time to spruce up a bit. Rooms are still solid and clean, but they are getting a bit worn and tired looking and feeling. New room keys are too temperamental. A modest overhaul ought to bring The Dunes right back to its deserved position along the ocean at Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for weekend trip to OC!”
Reviews.Author: travelingwithboys
Reviews.Content: We went to Ocean City over memorial day weekend - and got a great rate for this hotel. The hotel is extremely quiet at night - which was fantastic. All rooms have a great view and small oceanfront balcony. We booked a standard 2 queen room, and found it to be larger than expected with plenty of room for 2 adults and 2 teens. The beach in front of the hotel was wide and clean, and relatively uncrowded. Easy access to the boardwalk, and a Fractured Prune donut shop right in front of the hotel. While the rooms are a bit dated, it was clean and for the price and location - we found it to be perfect! Also, we arrived really early - 11am - and they were happy to give us a parking pass and called us when our room was ready - which was around noon.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable Beds”
Reviews.Author: chelle10010
Reviews.Content: I wish I could have given this hotel a higher rating because there were a lot of things that I enjoyed about it, but there were also a lot of negatives too. The Positive: This hotel is generally clean, has nice staff, free internet, free parking, and I like that all of the rooms have an ocean view with a balcony. The Negative: Location: If you are visiting Ocean City because you want to enjoy the boardwalk then this hotel is not for you, especially if you are not keen on walking a lot. This hotel is all the way at the end of the boardwalk and is pretty far from even the first boardwalk restaurant. The main amusements will take you at least 15-20 minutes to walk to. There is a tram so the location is ok if you want to be on the less crowded quieter end of the beach, but you will need to pay $3 per person each way on the tram to get to the other end. Loud, Because of the gaps under the doors joining the rooms you will hear everything everyone says in the room next door. I was woken up by talking in the next room every single day of our trip. I could hear everything they talked about like they were sitting right next to me, and i'm sure they heard me as well. Uncomfortable Beds, I have been to so many hotels in my life, and I have never encountered a bed that was so uncomfortable that I lost sleep over it, until I came to this hotel. My boyfriend thought the beds were fine, but I just couldn't fall asleep in them. They have weird bumps that dig into your back that kept me tossing and turning every night. Also the blankets are made of some cheap felt like material that had my scratching myself all night long.

Reviews.Title: “This has everything you need.”
Reviews.Author: LittleEb
Reviews.Content: All rooms face the ocean and have balconies. Wonderful dining room, a separate lounge, indoor pool, outdoor pool (they combine), weight room, free tea and scones in the afternoon, free coffee in the morning in the reception area. Wonderful piano playing and sing alongs in the evening and a cute gift and jewerly shop. Oh, and a walk-out back porch with rocking chairs and outside dining and bar area. Only a few feet from the upper end of the boardwalk. You will love Ocean City,MD and all it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Best mistake ever!!”
Reviews.Author: familyjav
Reviews.Content: So I forgot to make hotel reservations. We got into OCMD and saw this hotel. I called and they said they had rooms. Boy, did they ever!! We had such a lovely visit! Opening the door and hearing the ocean from our ocean front room was right what the doctor ordered! The hotel staff was wonderful, couldn't have been any more accomodating. The room was clean, the beds were comfy and we felt like we were in a higher priced hotel. Thank you Dunes Manor for allowing us a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that is showing its age”
Reviews.Author: wiserperson36
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Dunes Manor Hotel for over 15 years. Sad to say it is showing its age. The staff is always nice but the furnishings are dated to back in the 80's. For the rates that are charged, there should have been some updating of rooms. The bathroom had old fixtures and the sink was so old it looked like cracks were present. I think I will be looking for a newer hotel for this years stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a place!”
Reviews.Author: travelbwj
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here recently during a road trip to our winter home in Florida, and we loved it! The staff was so nice, and the decor, while not modern, was so nice and victorian. I would highly recommend it, easy to get to, great location and wonderful service! Excellent hotel! Plus, the weather was unnaturally warm for the time of year we were there, so we almost had the beach to ourselves - definitly a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed...”
Reviews.Author: GoneCoastal01
Reviews.Content: Old and Stuffy. Beds old and hard, decor dated. So many more newer and nicer hotels now in OC. This place has passed it's Prime. Not for families with children. Holiday Inn on 17th and the boards is a much better choice. Won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful getaway during the winter!”
Reviews.Author: Lakeview5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been coming to the Dunes for several years now. We always come during January or February and take advantage of an inexpensive getaway. This is a lovely hotel and one that we would not be able to afford during the peak season, so it is nice to be able to take advantage of the amenities during a more affordable time. We love the view from their oceanfront rooms which are clean and well appointed. The hotel is located just at the beginning of the boardwalk, so that we can take walks along that when the temperatures aren't too cold. We also take advantage of their oceanfront dining room and have breakfast there at least one morning of our stay. Although the town is pretty quiet during the winter months we enjoy going antiquing and dining at the restaurants that remain open. We return year after year and will continue to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service/ Great Views”
Reviews.Author: bluehenfan077
Reviews.Content: I just got back from 2 nights at the Dunes Manor. I haven't stayed there in about 7 years, but I remembered the wonderful view of the ocean and a nice afternoon tea. The view and the tea were my main reasons for visiting the beach in winter. An old friend went with me and we got the connecting rooms we'd requested. I'd done the reserving on line for both rooms, but forgot to bring the credit card I'd used for this. It meant front desk had to cancel out both room reservations and start over with a new card. The attendant at the front desk could not have been nicer about the extra work. I found almost everyone we dealt with to be extremely friendly and helpful. I must say the furniture, tv and bedding were a little dated, but matress wasn't bad and everything was clean (except the elevator tracts!....why is this always overlooked in 90% of the hotels I've stayed in ?- a pet peeve from my days as a facilities manager) . We had drinks at the little lounge along with delicious steamed shrimp that were $5.99 in the bar during happy hour. The same shrimp were on dinner menu for over $9 so it was a good deal. (Only get about 6 or 7 shrimp but they were big, cooked perfectly with old bay, and already devained ). My friend doesn't travel much and on two occasions had the deadbolt lock on her front door, came into my room throught the connecting doors, closing hers behind her and it lock from inside her room. This meant maintenance had to come 2x to work on getting her back into her room. Both times they were really nice and friendly.Food was the problem. Menu was typical hotel fare and overpriced. Afternoon Tea was a big disappointment. The tea itself is served from an urn. No choice in flavors and only lukewarm. The only non friendly person I ran into was standing by a tray of very stale cookies with a pair of tongs and a frown on her face, placing the cookies you chose on your plate. They were unedible. There was a small dish with cold crumpets that were cut into quarters and a bowl of cold margarine as well as a bowl of decent orange marmalade. It was kind of pitiful and embarrassing. Just didn't seem as nice as it was years ago. Would stay again, but wouldn't be disappointed if I missed the afternoon tea. Worth staying for the wonderful view and great service.

Reviews.Title: “We stumbled into this beautiful hotel but loved it!”
Reviews.Author: AdirondackGypsy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. We were there just after Christmas and was all decorated and looked beautiful. Our room was clean and the help was very friendly. We would visit this location again!

Reviews.Title: “Old, worn out hotel”
Reviews.Author: TurdFerguson13
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a Christmas stay at the Dunes Manor. Overall, I believe this is a hotel well past its prime, and the decor, staff, and majority of the guests reflect that. Obviously this is the off season for Ocean City, so keep that in mind. Common areas: The hotel has a lounge area with a piano. Some nights a woman does play piano there - and at least during the holidays, expect the sofas and chairs to be full of older folks singing Christmas carols. There is "Zippy's Lounge," which is a small bar on the beach side of the lounge. The bartenders are friendly enough and have a very "heavy hand." The prices are also outstanding, especially during happy hour. Zippy's was the only high point of the visit for me. The hotel restaraunt is old, and the menu selections are standard hotel fare. None of the meals were particularly appetizing, although the bacon is a highlight at breakfast. The service is the killer, however. We ate three meals during our stay; during two of them, wait staff spilled food on us. The staff appeared dirty and smelled like cigarettes as well. Not appetizing. Rooms: Outdated, in desperate need of renovation. The mattresses were old and creaky, and the TVs are old LCD types. The paint is faded and peeling, and the bathrooms look like they haven't been renovated in 20 years. The towels and sheets also appear to be very old. They were clean, but worn and dingy looking. The high points: Bacon at breakfast. Stiff, cheap drinks at the bar. Free, ample parking. The location is right on the boardwalk and beach. Low points: Staff in restaraunt. Outdated rooms and common areas. Linens and towels. Unless you can stay for free, or have some other reason to stay, I'd recommend the Hilton a few blocks North or the Courtyard about ten blocks South. Both are newer, have better service, and are located on the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed visit to Dunes Manor”
Reviews.Author: obxn
Reviews.Content: Spent another relaxing visit to Dunes Manor.Usual courtesy and friendliness from staff.Basic room decor and room was very clean. Our room could have used a little updating i.e flat screen and shower head and furniture replacement but everything was very very satisfactory. A great value for price in the off season with a senior discount. I believe they have upgraded their wireless signal as it was very strong and very easy to connect. This trip we had great meals at the Dunes on premise restaurant, Fageers island and Carrabbas and of course the visit to Fractured Prune. The view from ocean front balconies was spectacular. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Season”
Reviews.Author: southside15203
Reviews.Content: I go to O C Md. every First Fri. weekend in Dec, Winterfest Parade and Lights .Love staying at Dunes Manor very festive for Christmas. Great restaurant. afternoon tea and things for children .Great rates in winter also. Lots of things to do to get in the Holiday feeling. Try it sometime ,I've been doing it for about 18 years.

Reviews.Title: “My Runaway Happy Place”
Reviews.Author: JoyceM W
Reviews.Content: Ha, I recently stayed at the Dunes Manor Hotel. From the moment I checked in I felt at home. Upon checking in, I said that I was alone, running away from home for a weekend....so I wanted everything to be perfect. He smiled and said.. OK, I can do that !! The room was great, the view was awesome, the service was fantastic. The entire staff was awesome. The waitresses in the restaurant were pleasant, funny and willing to engage in a conversation. The location is only one of the reasons I chose The Dunes. I have stayed there before and am a frequent visitor to Ocean City.....It's a perfect location.......Right there in the midst of the action, but a beautiful quiet escape. The balcony is private enough to enjoy the moonlight and the sunrise with just you !! I will definitely visit again...the holidays must be beautiful there (so I'm told)

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the my stay”
Reviews.Author: terps101
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel. Room was plain but adequate. The bed was great. The staff was very pleasant. Check-in was friendly & quick. Enjoyed the pool & the rocking chairs on the front porch. They have many old OC pictures throughout the lobby - enjoyed looking at them. Several restaurants within walking distance. Easy access to the board walk. Only complaint was the coffe was not very hot in the morning. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Comfort during a Nor'easter”
Reviews.Author: Dianadean
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have a home away from home at the Dunes Manor in Ocean City, Maryland. For the best 8 years we take a long weekend just to enjoy each other mainly in the Fall and Winter. We stay on the top floor so I can watch the stars move across the sky. Actually, we try to go for the full moon. There is nothing like watching the full moon rise out of the ocean. It starts way out over the horizon as a flicker of gold. As you watch it slowly rise it makes a golden path right to the surf. The Dunes is the perfect place to watch the moon rise because every room is oceanfront. Sunrise is equally fantastic. You can watch it right from your bed! The staff are very helpful and accommodating from the reservationist to Kimberly at the front desk. Tea and crumpets are served daily at 3:00 and Thursday through Sunday there is a sing-a-long in the lobby. Enjoy the restaurant or Zippy's lounge. There is a pool and a nice jewelry shop as well. And of course if you want to take your family during the summer, the Dunes enjoys the best location. The boardwalk is steps away from the hotel and you can either take a tram or walk the 2.5 miles to the Inlet and enjoy Thrasher's French fries, Fisher's pop-corn, Love's lemonade, arcade games, shopping, and rides . Ocean City has the best sand and surf EVER and all of this is at the Dunes Manor Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Dunes Manor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: funlovinginNewYork
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dunes Manor past summer. It is a beautiful hotel with all oceanfront rooms. The location is good because it is at the start of the boardwalk but still quiet. You can hop on the tram to get to the busier end of the boardwalk or easily walk it.

Reviews.Title: “Greata Place for groups or families”
Reviews.Author: Chocolatemaj
Reviews.Content: I was introduced to Dunes Manor three years ago when my high school classmates put together a weekend to reconnect. The view is fantastic, The boardwalk is only one block away, but allows for a quiet retreat. The restaurant inside the hotel has great food, and the pub and grill is also a nice addition to the amenities. Our housekeeper, Nicki, was very attentive to our needs. While we enjoyed the evening music, four hours straight, along with the singing, is a little much, especially since there is no place to escape unless you want to go out or stay in your room. It also made it difficult to listen to the TV in pub and we could not follow the baseball or football games. It would be nice if there were a quiet area where you could enjoy some quiet time reading as the lighting in the room is not soft, and kept my husband from sleeping. As far as services for our group, the hotel was very accommodating and our dinner was superb.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T MISS BREAKFAST”
Reviews.Author: Culebrabeachbum
Reviews.Content: I recently returned to the Dunes Manor Hotel with my husband for an end of summer visit to Ocean City, Maryland. Although we are now Florida residents, we have a soft spot for this Eastern Shore beach resort having first gone there as children over seventy years ago. We found this hotel to be a relaxing and serene place with an ocean front balcony to view stunning sunrises and to hear the soothing sound of the surf on the beach. Although not a five star hotel, there is a broad array of hospitality from the helpful staff, tea in the afternoon, happy hour, morning coffee in the lobby, lemon water for a refreshing drink just to name a few. The best of all is breakfast in the hotel dining room. This is truly a hidden gem that one needs to discover. My favorite is Eggs Florentine. This dish is prepared wuth lump crab meat and it is truly to die for. The Phyllo dough cups lined with fresh spinach, topped with crab,perfectly poached eggs and a creamy Mornay Sauce is worth the trip to Ocean City. If you are passing this way, don't miss this treat that I feel cannot be matched anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “off season stay not good for using pool”
Reviews.Author: Jessica F
Reviews.Content: My mom has knee issues and when making our reservation for a few days in Oct. asked if the pool was indoor and had stairs down into the pool with rail. The hotel did not mention to her that the pool was an indoor/outdoor pull and the stair part was actually on the outside part. It was too cold to be entering the pool from this side so we did not go swimming which was a disappointment. For this reason we would not go back to the hotel. However the hotel was nice, clean and comfortable to stay at otherwise. We enjoyed the tea in the afternoon and the staff were very nice. We did eat at the main restaurant and found that the food was not really up to par and would not eat there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: OttandBea
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Dune Manor Hotel the second week in October. The assistant manager Janice made a very good impression. She took the time to explain the hotel amenities and recommended the hotel restaurants. The room was comfortable and the beds were great (nice and firm). The neighbors were a little rowdy at times but that's not the hotels fault. All and all it was a great stay. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice ten story hotel on the beach.”
Reviews.Author: travelCity60763
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel on the beach. Great staff, covered parking , nice view!

Reviews.Title: “Great Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: beckiwp
Reviews.Content: It's like a big family getaway, We LOVE the sing-alongs in the lobby, Takes me back to simpler times.

Reviews.Title: “Third time at the Dunes, quaint hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nlovesjamaica
Reviews.Content: This has been my third trip to the Dunes Manor hotel in Ocean City, MD. My boyfriend and I traveled with his parents for the labor day weekend. The hotel was crowded because of the popular weekend but as normal, the staff were all very friendly and accommodating. This year we stayed in a standard double room, and the rooms are decent, they are clean and do the job, most of the time we were not in the room. The beds are comfortable, and the air conditioning works great. The balcony is spacious and all of the balconies are ocean front which is great for viewing dolphins and the sunrise. The location is great, its only 1 block off of the boardwalk and is easily accessible through a parking lot or sand path. The tram car stop is at the end of the boardwalk too so you can either choose to walk or take the tram car. The Victorian Room restaurant has the best breakfast, the Manor Benedict and the Neptune Benedict are family favorites. We had dinner at the Victorian room one night and it was very good. Zippy's Bar and Lounge has a fabulous happy hour and do not forget to get free tea and crumpets in the afternoon. It is a great snack after the beach and before dinner and happy hour! Also right across the street is the Fractured Prune-- highly recommended donuts, they are wonderful. They have a few locations in MD and DE but we always stop when we are in town. Another favorite is Peppers Tavern on the boardwalk, great mexican food as well as Margaritas! Overall we had a great stay at the Dunes Manor, and probably will return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: elevenstars
Reviews.Content: This hotel was reasonably priced when compared to most other hotels in Ocean City, and while it was not five star, it met our needs very nicely. The location was great, right on the ocean and across from Jolly Roger Amusements, and many other restaurants. The restaurant on-site served a very good breakfast, with outside seating on the deck. The bar food was not great and service was slow. The rooms were a bit dated, the beds not very comfortable, but roomy and clean nonetheless, with a good air conditioner and spacious balcony. Would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Quite surprised”
Reviews.Author: Jihoonie
Reviews.Content: We planned an almost last-minute vacation to Ocean City and basically reviewed hotels on Trip Advisor and through AAA. All the reviews on the Dunes were excellent, but of course we were skeptical as we had never stayed here. The main reasons we would recommend this hotel: 1. LOCATION: Beachfront with an oceanfront view from every room. And, the hotel is just one block North of the Boardwalk, meaning that it's close enough to get to the boardwalk, but not right on it. We traveled with a one-year-old, so we took the trolley down to the busy part of the boardwalk and walked it all the way back. 2. BEACHFRONT: balcony overlooking the beach was great 3. PARKING: on-site and plenty of it. We had a rooftop cargo carrier on our minivan, and had no problem parking under the covered-portion of the parking. There's also an outdoor lot right in front. 4. ROOMS: we traveled with a large pack-n-play for our one-year-old to sleep in and had no problem fitting it in a standard, double bed room. We wanted a suite/efficiency, but our last-minute booking made that impossible. Hopefully next year! Rooms were clean, beds were ok, and cleaning service very responsive. 5. Restaurant, Morning Coffee, and Music: We didn't really stay in the hotel and use their amenities, but the Dunes has a great ambience and family-friendly atmosphere. Something you won't find in the large, chain hotels. In summary, we were pleasantly surprised by the Dunes Hotel. I would pick this over the Motel, which is right next door. We'll definitely be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait till go back”
Reviews.Author: Erin M
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fantastic from the view to the service. Waking up to the beach was like paradise. The only negative was that the elevators were extremely slow(we waited 20 mins one time) and that if you tried to take the stairs you would get yelled at. When you in such a great place no body wants be slowed down by elevators. Otherwise it was a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Would Return Again”
Reviews.Author: Brenda-from-Balto
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the hotel for two nights (mid week) in August. Check in was efficient and the staff friendly. All rooms are ocean view. We were on the top floor so we had no overhead on our balcony (which I was told when I booked). The view was great and we didn't spend much time out there on such a short trip so it was not a problem. Room was very clean. Ocean access was easy with a shower to rinse off right at the door. Umbrella and chair rental was right on the beach as well. We ate breakfast in the Victorian Room which was very good (and reasonable). The posted sunset dinner and happy hour specials were bargains. Free popcorn in the Zippy lounge in the evening, free cookies and iced or hot tea daily from 3 to 4 and free coffee in the AM. Location was great - one block from the boardwalk and tram station. This was my first stay and I would return again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: wildrob
Reviews.Content: Dunes Manor was very clean,staff helpful and friendly looking forward to next trip

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tommysmom22602
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying here for 3 nights! The motel was very nice. Our room and bathroom were very clean, no mold anywhere! The beds are comfortable and sheets were spotless! Trust me I am very picky when it comes to clean due to my allergies!! Staff was very pleasant. They are a little expensive for what you get but I suggest that you book with the Rodney saves website to get free passes and that kinda evens it out. The restaurant is expensive but the breakfast we ate there was great. The only negative thing I can say is they need an outdoor shower to rinse off with before entering the motel from the beach. We never used the pool or even seen it, so I can't say anything about that. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “nice location, needs updating, cleaning”
Reviews.Author: bebedani
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a nice location at the end of the boardwalk. It is also off the road, so the noise levels are low. Every room has a balcony and an ocean view which is great. The lobby is nice with an old victorian theme. They have a piano and there was a guy playing in the afternoon. I went here for work and didnt spend too much time in the room. The rooms however are outdated and dirty. My room had cereal in the wall unit (A/C) and there were crumbs in all the corners and hard to reach with the vaccum areas. The rooms have a mini fridge and microwave, it also has a coffe maker. The drapes had holes in them which i didnt notice until the sun came up and shone threw the holes. The front desk gave all departing guests a letter asking us to update trip advisor, i do hope that they will update and clean these rooms, I would come back if they did.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry but to expensive for the quality.”
Reviews.Author: Funkyme1972
Reviews.Content: We stayed here due to a business trip my husband. He stayed here before so that is why he chose this one again. I have to say it was fairly clean and a nice location for the beach, but the help here was NOT overly friendly except the Barefoot Grill bartender . Also the out door pool was dissappointing and unkept.The price they are charging for the rooms here is NOT worth it at all. We travel a lot and I was dissappointed here for $267.00 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - we will come again next year”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn V
Reviews.Content: We have visisted this hotel before and we experienced the same clean rooms, clean property and great service again this year. There is a great sand bar to visit for lunch, snacks or a drink on the way in from the beach. The porch nas wonderful wooden rocking chairs and faces the oceans, as do all of the rooms. We have stayed here many times and will be back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “The Greatest Place I ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: Darsena S
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is awesome. The staff are ALL very attentive and eager to please. Between the restaurant and the cafe's, one would never have to leave the place. The rooms were great with the oceanfront decks, the food was wonderful, and breakfast by the beach outside was superb. I have been vacationing in Ocean City for years and I will never stay anywhere else but at the Dunes.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Mary1006
Reviews.Content: We had a chance to take family to the beach at the last minute, and checled their website. We were accommodated quickly and pleasantly. Two adjacent rooms for 4 adults and 2 grandchildren. Staff was courteous and knowledgable. Our chain lock for balcony on 7th floor needed to be repaired, and it was fixed immediately. Rooms were clean, kept clean during our five days. Enjoyed the three restaurants - one more formal (Victorian room), outside deck with flowers and rocking chairs (lovely), and bar/grill on beach level was convenient. Beach immediately in front of hotel; free parking, bellhops. Loved indoor-outdoor pool. One block from boardwalk and tram, 7-Eleven and laundry nearly, as was amusement park, water park and miniature golf. Bus line also on main drag. Food was delicious, kitchen was quick, staff was pleasant and friendly. This is not a five star resort, but had elements of it. Yes, we will return!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Experience”
Reviews.Author: Travelfun095
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a third floor beachfront unit in August 2011. The room was clean and nicely furnished. The view was excellent with double windows and a balcony overlooking the beach. The weather was good enough to leave the windows open to fall asleep and awake to the sound of the ocean waves rolling in. The hotel's location helped since it is just north of the end of the boardwalk. It is close enough to walk to catch a boardwalk tram yet far enough away to avoid noise. Beach access is excellent - just walk out the lower level and you're there. The beach was realtively uncrowded for such a popular time of year. The hotel is attractive, parking is plentiful, and staff service prompt and courteous. The only negatives we found were minor: slow elevators and some hotel staff taking smoke breaks in the underground garage. Overall, we greatly enjoyed our stay and will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel...we will be back soon!!!”
Reviews.Author: Linda R
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice family Hotel! My husbands Mom died on Sunday Aug 7th so we had to shorten our stay by 1 night. Kimberly at the Front Desk could not have been nicer. She was very sympathetic and understanding. She is true example of Excellent Customer Service!!! She gave us a refund of the 3rd night. We will be returning next year.The hotel was clean.The pool area was nice and the lady watching the Hot Tub(HOT) and pool was great :) The view from the room was Fantastic...OMG!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely view”
Reviews.Author: S W
Reviews.Content: The lobby is fairly nice and the ocean front views are lovely. The piano playing in the lobby is great fun for all. But the rooms are small and VERY average - especially for the $260+ per night rate. The mini-fridge and mini-micro worked most of the time. The staff members were reasonably helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “The DUnes is great as always”
Reviews.Author: triciawingert
Reviews.Content: 5th stay here! This is the best hotel. great view of the beach, easy to get down to the water, Great shower coming back in, only one block to the boardwalk and Tram. Out of the way but so close to everything. Front desk told me they will be remodling all rooms starting in October. Cant wait to see the upgrades. The bathrooms are the only things that need remodling and even so they are workable now. Room service leaves much to be desired (for the first time) Bars are awsome! Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and would reccomend this hotel to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: vlf67
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just had an all-around good time there.The decor was beautiful.and all the staff was very nice.The rooms were very clean.Our room was on the 6th floor and the view was spectacular.We enjoyed tea time and singing around the piano in the evening.The towels are pretty scratchy,they need some fabric softener.Im glad we didnt stay on the boardwalk thats for sure.Couldnt have asked for a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better!”
Reviews.Author: smcnulty2
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at the Dunes Manor in Ocean City, Maryland. We got there early and Kimberly at the front desk could not have been more accomodating to us. Since parking in Ocean City can be a challenge she gave us a parking pass to allow us to park at the hotel before we checked in. She also gave us a pass to use the changing rooms and pool if we wanted. The staff at the hotel was very kind and helpful. It could almost be classified as an "all-inclusive" since everything you might want is there. We met many wonderful guests from other places and spent hours talking with them on the beautiful porch, rocking chairs included, overlooking the ocean. Our room was very nice. Our only complaint was that the towels were quite rough on your skin. Otherwise, an extremely relaxing and rejuvinating trip. Hope to see y'all soon!

Reviews.Title: “Only good reason to stay here is the location”
Reviews.Author: softlilangel99
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel a number of times. When you first walk into the lobby it looks beautiful!! BUT..it kind of stops there. The staff, I find is not friendly, but not rude. Just kind of doing their job. The rooms are VERY dated!!! The beds are pretty hard. The sheets do not fit on the bed. And the BLANKET? Bring your own..LoL. The rooms are clean. The ocean view is awesome!! The bathrooms are ok. The rooms have coffee makers and microwaves..so thats a plus. The tea time and piano player are good if you like that kind of thing. Mainly seniors...my grandma would love that. The food there is gross and very over priced! I have tryed it more than once...so I know it wasn't just an off day. The sun porch is great! The pool area is dirty and small. To the point that I wont let my children go there. The main reason to stay at this hotel is the location...it is right by the start of the boardwalk, yet you have a private beach in front of you!! And the view from your room is amazing. I have seen dolphins playing early in the morning a few times. Location, location,location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice View”
Reviews.Author: SandyChurchHill_MD
Reviews.Content: Great atmosphere, room was clean and nice. Helpful, courteous staff. Only one set of elevators, sometimes the wait for one was long and crowded. Beds weren't that comfortable, a little hard. Overall pretty nice. Free WiFi had no signal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: tylerraven
Reviews.Content: nice place. had trouble with loud music being played in adjacent room . would not stop even at 1 am. front desk took care of it. right on the beach. a few blocks away from boardwalk so you dont have all the crowds walking by and all the noise and riff-raff associated with it.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Steveandlauren
Reviews.Content: Online booking for this property CLEARLY indicated availability and allowed me to reserve an oceanfront, non-smoking room for 2 nights in the hotel. Just to be safe, I called reservations to verify before I completed the final step. I spoke to Debbie (with an attitude) who told me that although there technically was availability, it wouldn't be in the same room and I would have to check out at 10 and check back in at 3! She further informed me that if I had booked it online I would have had no choice but to take it because it was passed the cancellation period! This is so outrageous it's almost funny. Who knows what else they're not disclosing... "Well we don't actually have any beds in the room, but it's past the cancellation period so you'll just have to sleep on the floor."

Reviews.Title: “very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: cat60811
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel, staff friendly and efficient. could not do better. location great, maid service excellent. liked everything!

Reviews.Title: “We stay here every year.”
Reviews.Author: JSevera
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at the Dunes Manor every year for the past 8 years, and we will be back again next year. We love the location...the boardwalk ends at 27th St., and the hotel is located at 28th, so we're close to the boardwalk without being right on it. The staff is always friendly and accommodating. We enjoy the morning coffee in the lobby, afternoon tea, the poolside bar, the happy hour specials at Zippy's lounge. The restaurant at the hotel is really good! We usually have dinner there on our first night, and we are always impressed with the food. The crabcakes and also the stuffed flounder were fantastic! We also have a few breakfasts there as well. Every room is an ocean view room, which is very nice. The rooms themselves are not exactly 5-star quality, but they are OK, given the price and location. The bathrooms are small and a little worse for wear, and one of our beds this year had a pronounced dip in the middle. And the elevator situation is not ideal. 2 small elevators for a hotel of this size get very busy during check-in and check-out times. I wish we could use the stairs! But obviously, these drawbacks do not keep us from coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: koonsce
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Dunes Manor for a long holiday weekend. Check-in was a breeze when we arrived, and our room was ready for us. The room was extremely large; even with a king size bed, small table, and chairs, there was plenty of room to store our luggage. While the hotel is not brand new, the room was clean and I had no complaints about that. It could, however, use some updating. The bed was fine for me, but I did notice when we left that the fitted sheet didn't quite fit the bed (as mentioned in another review). Since it was on my husband's side, I didn't really notice, and he didn't mention it, so it must not have bothered him too much. All of the rooms are oceanfront, which is wonderful! The balcony is not huge, but it was fine for us to sit out and enjoy the ocean breeze. The hotel has tea and snacks every afternoon, which was a nice touch. There's also a restaurant (we had lunch there out on the porch, and it was really good) and several bars. The room was cleaned every day while we were out for breakfast...this was a very nice surprise, as we've stayed places where the room wasn't cleaned until after lunch or even later. The location is probably the best thing about this hotel. You are right off the end of the boardwalk, and lots of restaurants and other entertainment is close by. Since we were there over the holiday weekend, it was crowded, but there was never an issue finding a decent place on the beach, even though we never seemed to make it out there until after 11 A.M. Overall, I'd stay here again. It is a bit pricey, but you're right off the boardwalk and facing the ocean. Other oceanfront hotels we looked at were even more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated”
Reviews.Author: MadCobraStyle
Reviews.Content: Great location and beach front. Adequate free parking. Rooms are outdated. No internet access, not enough outlets in room. Biggest problem was a noisy, rattling air conditioner that keep us awake for 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good beachfront value but a few problems”
Reviews.Author: Shannon S
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights here and while not the most luxurious hotel in town it was a good value for a beachfront hotel. All rooms in the hotel, not the attached motel, are ocean view - a necessity for me. My kids loved the afternoon tea and crumpets served in the lobby. The beach is right out the back door and there are rocking chairs on the back veranda to sit and watch the waves. The hotel is just past the end of the boardwalk so you can easily catch the tram to go down the boardwalk in the evening. The pool was not great, very small and part indoors, part outdoors but with the beach steps away we never even went in the pool. The room was a standard hotel room - the beds and pillows a little hard for me but no one else in my family seemed to mind. It is an older hotel and I met a lot of people who have been coming to the Dunes for years. The free wifi connection only seems to work in the lower floors and the lobby. But at under $200 a night for a clean ocean front hotel I have come to not expect all the bells and whistles. My only other complaint would be the midnight fire alarm that went off and again at 9 in the morning. We all quickly evacuated down in our pjs but there was no direction from the staff. I didn't see anyone guiding guests or receive any explanation the next day as to what happened. Luckily it seemed to be a false alarm as the fire department let us back in after about 15 minuted out in the cold but the elevators were not turned back on so the 11 flight trek upstairs at 12:30am was not good. I realize the hotel is not responsible for the alarm but I would have liked some more information as to what was going on. Even given these problems we would probably stay here again. Overall it is a good value in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: piecesofadream
Reviews.Content: I just came back from an overnight trip in Ocean City at Dunes Manor. It was a very basic hotel, best for a weekend that will mostly be spent out and about on the beach. Best to be used for sleeping and showering. It did have a few perks/pluses: Tea Time, they allowed us to park in the lot early before check in, after you check out you can still come in to take showers before you head out, the balconies are defintely a plus. The only downside is that it wasn't a " luxurious " hotel, not the cleanest, not the best towels, but clean enough to sleep in and secure enough to feel safe. Great Location too!

Reviews.Title: “I loved it & will stay there from now on"”
Reviews.Author: ArashDash
Reviews.Content: I travel to Ocean City Maryland frequently during the year for business and I usually stay at either the Hilton or Holiday Inn Suites Resorts. But the last weekend my usual hotels were book so I looked for other accommodations on the beach and I came across the Dune Manor Suites, which a friend of mine was staying at. As soon as I got there the hotel felt so warm and accommodating and the front desk staff was so nice. Especially a young lady by the name of Kimberly who went out of her way to make sure to give me the best service as possible even going out of her way to make sure my friends rooms were moved next to mine and that our accommodations were to our liking. I wish there were more front desk staff like her making it there duty to make sure the customers are satisfied with their rooms and service. She is definitely a great asset to that hotel. The rooms were spacious and comfortable; it felt like being at home away from home. The large ocean front balconies were absolutely gorgeous waking up in the morning to enjoy the sceneries. I absolutely loved my stay there and will probably never stay anywhere else when I come in to town.

Reviews.Title: “We spurged and enjoyed the weekend”
Reviews.Author: bdaygirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was supposedly discounted for our lacrosse team and we opted to splurge for the $199/night to stay with the team. We were checked in, moved in and on the beach in 45 minutes with the help of the friendly front desk staff and helpful bellboys. Several folks thought the rooms were small but we had 601 on the corner and I thought it was a good size - two queen beds, desk, dresser, tv, table with two chairs, micro, frig and coffee maker with a decent closet. One bed was right up against the AC but the other had a lot of room between the bed and wall. Would probably be a tight fit for a family of four with beach gear but if you get a spot in the underground garage you could leave beach stuff in the car for easy access from the elevator to the garage to the beach. Other post about the sheets was correct, very thin and don't fit the bed, but I did my usual bed bug check and found very clean sheets, mattress and comforter. Pillows were pretty comfortable too. Little frig had tons of room in the door for water bottles and shelves were big enough for fruit, milk, yogurt and other breakfast goodies. The freezer compartment worked especially well. Private balcony was great for early morning and late afternoon. Bathroom is spacious but sink is inside the bathroom which makes it difficult for multiple people to get ready. Water-saver shower head wasn't powerful but is good for the environment! One block from the boardwalk makes this a relatively quiet spot that is close to the action. Only complaint was that the drapery does not adequately block the morning sun and the room got bright very early! The blinds on the door to the balcony don't block the sun at all.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean front room was really close to the ocean with a beautiful view and was well worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: Phil143
