Reviews.Content: All the rooms have an ocean front with balcony and our room was very clean and well maintained. The staff was friendly and allowed us into the room before the check-in time.

Reviews.Title: “Always come back to the Dunes.....”
Reviews.Author: MMcKnight
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel.....I've stayed here for many years and decided to try a new place this year. Well needless to say, I ended up back at the Dunes. Hotel is very clean, staff is friendly, food is good and moderately priced, view is spectacular from your private balcony and from the porch deck. Very comfortable here and don't know why I wanted to try someplace else!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming oceanfront hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ginny1234_5678
Reviews.Content: The Dunes Manor has a charming ambience. Tea and cookies are served in the lobby every afternoon (among delightfully overstuffed furniture) and every room faces the ocean (and has a balcony). Also, there is a deck facing the ocean off the lobby which has Adirondack chairs with which to view the ocean. At Christmas they have special events, including a nightly piano player with sing-alongs, visits from "Santa" and a very family-friendly atmosphere. The dining room is excellent, again with views of the ocean. Additionally, the rooms are always clean, well-maintained and comfortable. All this at a very affordable price! I have been there at various times of the year, and it is always one of the high points of my trips to the East Coast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location ~ Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JNCHIXON
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have stayed at the Dunes Manor for the past 2 years and plan on going back. We like the fact that all of the rooms are oceanfront with a private balcony, it's at the end of the boardwalk, yet still close to Jolly Roger Amusement Park. The staff has always been friendly & corteous. The rooms could use a little updating but what hotel in Ocean City couldn't?? As long as they're clean, it works for us. We go in September so the prices are a little cheaper...and it's not as busy. The pool area is a little on the small side but I don't go to the beach for a swimming pool so with that said we spend little of our time there. We find this overall to be a wonderful place to stay without the Hilton prices ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice place; Pleasant time”
Reviews.Author: njslim
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights on the 10th floor. Check-in was easy and we were quickly in our room. The room was very clean and contained a coffee maker, small refrigerator and comfortable beds. The room would be considered on the small side but for us it was sufficient. Since we arrived late in the day we decided to have dinner at the hotel. The food delicious, ocean/beach view was nice and the wait staff were pleasant, efficient and made us feel comfortable. We sat outside on the veranda a few times during our stay (early morning and in the evening) enjoying the view of the ocean over the top of the dunes. The boardwalk was a block away and provided a place to take a casual stroll. The afternoon tea in the lobby is a nice way to relax prior to getting ready for dinner. The lobby is a bit small so I can see it getting very crowded if a lot of guest show up for tea. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “terrible rude ignorent staff in the main lobby,will ruin your entire vacation,dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: miltonDavidsville
Reviews.Content: these people are the most rude people i have ever encountered,service is lousy and the pool is the worst,do yourself a favor and stay some where else.

Reviews.Title: “For the winter price not bad but....”
Reviews.Author: PattieK39
Reviews.Content: We took a two day trip to O.C. for the first time with our two boys ages 9 & 6 during the Christmas break. I'm big on reading reviews & feel that you can get a good sense of where your staying or product your buying off others opinions. Keeping that in mind & remembering while reading them that they are just that...opinions! I look for the facts in the reviews or try to anyway. I found the reviews on the Dunes to be confusing. Where one person said it was the best sleep ever at a hotel, there was a conflicting review stating just the opposite. One person said the staff was super nice & another said they were rude. I'm not sure if all the rooms at the Dunes are identical or if they have a lot of staff changing but I can tell you what our room was like & what we experienced and I'll try to stick to the facts. We stayed on the 6th floor. It was small but decent. It was clean and there were no cracked floor tile or rocking toilets. A plus for me was their water was filtered so you could actually drink it :) A fidge, microwave & coffee maker were a plus too. You have to remember that most of these hotels in O.C. are extremely old & way over used so unless remodeled you should have too high of expectations. The bed for me may have been close to the worst ever though. The sheets were rough (about 175 TC) and didn't fit the bed. The blanket atop the sheets was about 100 years old & nasty. All I could think about as I tried to become comfortable in a strange bed was re-adjusting these slipping, used sheets in the middle of the night and what I would if I awoke to a matress under me. The mattress was average, not too hard or soft so I guess thats good and I didn't awake with any numb areas so that was good too. I found no holes in my sheets like another reviewer wrote about and trust me I looked...right away.. but my pillowcase was stained a bit (I flip it & tried to forget about it). The staff of the Dunes I didn't find over happy or rude, just average. The best part I guess was the pool. My boys thought that was the neatest thing for part of it was outside in the 20 degree temps & wind and the other half inside. Because of that it wasn't very warm and that could explain why the adults weren't getting in. I will say the older man that watches over the pool was very disturbing. He yelled at my younger son for splashing...yes splashing and getting a drop of water on his leg! The inside pool area is small and the area around the pool where you sit is small too so everyone is right up close to the pool. The man never smiled or seemed too thrilled to converse with anyone either which made you feel like an intruder so we didn't stay long. Unfortunately we never ate at the restaurant so I have no input...sorry. We did walk by as they had the afternoon tea & crimpets but we didn't join in. It seemed to be mostly older folks and with two small boys we just weren't comfortable. All in all not bad but didn't do enough for me to return. Met a couple there that said they've been going back for three years in a row during Christmas & love it there...I just don't see it or I missed something :) I would recommend this in the winter for $49 a night is awesome but the summer I would go elsewhere I think so for that I'm clicking on that I would recommend it. I'm still searching for the place I'll return to I think...its probably the one I can't afford to stay in :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Christmas Trip”
Reviews.Author: beachlover5659
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dunes Manor for one night in December. We have stayed before and as always I love the location, I love the lobby (especially decorated for Christmas) and the Victorian Room is the best place for breakfast. During this particular weekend, they had MANY kids activities, including a train garden, a Santa visit, and Jingle the elf. My kids loved it! I like this hotel and would stay again; however, the rooms really do need to be remodeled. Our bathroom appeared to be dirty, but I'm not sure how clean they could actually get it with the older fixtures, tile, etc. The doors are bumped, scuffed, and chipped -- the rooms are just showing their age. Again, I would stay because I really like the feeling of the hotel; but hope that some remodeling is completed soon!

Reviews.Title: “The Ocean was VERY angry”
Reviews.Author: Karen J
Reviews.Content: Have been going to this hotel for MANY years. We can remember back to when the owner Thelma Conner served the tea. Well, she is in a better place now and those left here on the seashore are carrying out her legacy very well. So now you know there is afternoon tea and cookies, all ocean front rooms, a WONDERFUL porch with rockers to sit and look at the ocean. Zippys lounge is GREAT for happy hour (GREAT specials) and there is Shirley who tickles the keys of the baby grand on a few nights with sing alongs. Weather it is summer, fall, winter or spring it is ALWAYS a good time for a night or two to just sit back and look at the ocean. ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Great sea views”
Reviews.Author: dotdash
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel just out of season. It was a pleasant surprise. We were given a room on the 7th floor with amazing sea views, a balcony and the sound of the waves roaring below (in fact all rooms have sea views). The room was spacious and clean (perhaps a little dated) and we loved it. The hotel has an old world feel with complimentary tea served at 4pm each day in the lounge area. We only paid £43 for the king bedded room although this didn't include breakfast (we went to the Starbucks on the outskirts of town for this). The hotel is on a very long strip of hotels spanning something like 12 miles. There is a boardwalk out the front and the opportunity to walk on the beach. The sunrises are brilliant turning the sea pink, but you have to rise early! Staff at check in were both friendly and very informative and we didn't want to leave, despite our initial reservations of both the resort and the hotel itself. Loved it here and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It As Always!!!!”
Reviews.Author: crabcakes
Reviews.Content: We arrived Sat Oct 24 and left Oct. 25. What a wonderful long weekend we had! Myself, my sister and our hubby's enjoyed this weekend. The room and view are awesome. The service is excellent. The maintenence man Terry helped us out with our adjoining rooms. Thanks Terry for the door stopper!! They also have a happy hour every day from 4-7. Best ( huge ) shrimp that you could want. Chaz, the bartender/waiter is the bomb! Wings ok. Price is excellent. 4.99 for the shrimp and same for wings. What a deal! Hubby's enjoyed pool and hotub. Victorian Restaurant was delish. My sister loved the creamed dried beef for breakfast. Across the road we enjoyed Buxey's for the Steelers game on Sunday!!! YAY! Great food specials and attentive service there. You can't go wrong with the Dunes Manor!! Go and enjoy! :0)

Reviews.Title: “Great Ocean View”
Reviews.Author: kpkatlover
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ Dunes Manor Hotel a week for vacation.. Hotel was quiet. Staff was friendly. View of the ocean was wonderful..... Close to the boardwalk.. Room was clean, the ac could be cooler. We slept in the bed next ( or right on top of ac) and still wasn't cold... The room could been outlayed better.. ex. move the beds over for room to get between them, room to watch tv in chairs. The shower had excellent water presser... I'd like to have taken that home w/ me... Felt great on back...... Easy to get around to other places in OC/ boardwalk. Make sure you go to Fenwick Island and tour the lighthouse.. Excellent tour guides, and its a freebie... The only downfall was the breakfast we ate one morning in the hotel restaurant... both of us ordered eggs/bacon etc.. Lets just say, they was the smallest eggs I've ever seen.... If I guessed, it was maybe 1 egg between the both of us.... lol.. the group of people beside us complained about how small their eggs was.. so apparently, it wasn't just us..... For the price you would expect better service... Also the waitress apparently, didn't want to give refills on coffee... I'd most definately go somewhere else for breakfast to eat............ for more for your $$ and service... You can park in the gargage underneath the hotel, along with the parking lot outside.. I parked in the gargage and got an excellent parking space.. no one beside me to bang my doors & light over head..... We even went out several times and still got the parking spot...... Most everyone parked in the lot outside.. apparently didn't see the gargage... Would return again.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again..............”
Reviews.Author: GVFamily
Reviews.Content: The Dunes Manor Hotel was a great place to stay. Perfect location and walking distance to most places such as Rides, Restaurants, or Boardwalk. The young Lady that checked us in was awesome! She was friendly and on top of things. I have to say it was refreshing to see somebody so committed to giving superior service and dedicated to their job. My only concern came when somebody from the staff attempted to enter our room late one evening without knocking. Upon check out the same young lady that checked us in asked how our stay was. I just mentioned the small incident and she was unbelievably apologetic. She explained to me that she would look into it and talk to her manager than send my receipt in the mail. A few days later a hand written letter came with a small credit on my bill. I was honestly not looking for anything more than to let management know so they could review their policy's. Needless to say I was quite surprised with the credit and want to commend the young women for taking a proactive approach. She is an asset to your company and would recommend anybody looking for a perfect place to get away to try the Dunes Manor. Thanks again for top notch service!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Tour Groups”
Reviews.Author: oldenewengland3
Reviews.Content: I am a tour operator and recently stayed at Dunes Manor 3 nights with group of 50 adults. Everyone loved it! Very nice main dining room with great food and view.. Hotel's facilities and amenities (eg. afternoon tea) are excellent. The oceanfront balconies with spectacular view are incredible. We had a buffet breakfast each morning (specially arranged for group) that was ample and tasty. Guest rooms are clean and spacious. On-site parking for group's motorcoach. Capable and helpful front desk and dining room staff. I was very pleased and found no faults with Dunes Manor. Wonderful choice for large groups.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jimb_york_pa
Reviews.Content: This is a dirty hotel. Rooms are tired and need remodeling. The unadvertised policy of not allowing outside alcohol in your room (you have to buy it there) is just greedy. I doubt it's legal either. Can you imagine the maids searching your room for a bottle of illegal beer? There are better places to spend your money in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Great Victorian Themed Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Doctor_Beach
Reviews.Content: You can tell this is not a chain but a family owned hotel as the attentioned to detail is awesome. From the Christmas decorations, trees, train gardens, etc,, being in Ocean City before Christmas definately puts you into the Christmas spirit, The rooms are clean and comfortable and the indoor pool was warm and refreshing. The food at the restaurant was ok but nothing to write home about except it was very convenient being at the hotel. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: chip18Maryland
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at this hotel and we enjoyed our stay. The kids loved the indoor/outdoor pool. The tea time was a nice touch, too, as was the piano sing-a-long in the lobby every night. Loved the proximity to the boardwalk/beach and the great view of the beach from our room. WiFi in the lobby was also convenient. They had 3 pieces of equip in fitness center, but preferred to walk/run on beach and boardwalk anyway. Above all we found the staff to be extremely helpful and friendly. Asked for an extra blanket and it arrived less than 10 min. later. Great rocking chairs on the 'back porch" too. Our room was clean and didn't have the problems the other reviewer had.

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment After Years Of Visiting”
Reviews.Author: Alpachq
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a three day trip to the Dunes Manor. This is our sixth year in a row visiting the hotel and this was the first year we were disappointed. To start, the Dunes Manor has a lot of good things going for it such as Milton's Outdoor dining, balconies with a view of the ocean, pool (even small), afternoon tea and cookies,and a great location two blocks from the boardwalk. However, the hotel needs a MAJOR facelift. The rooms need a lot of help. The room size is great, but the rooms are starting to get dumpy. Our bathroom had floor tiles that were cracked and looked dirty. The toilet moved from side to side when you sat on it and I found hairs all over the bathroom when we first checked in. Two of the pillowcases on our bed were stained and the bottom sheet on one of the beds had a giant hole. It took several calls to the front desk to get these problems resolved. We have loved this hotel in the past, but are thinking twice about ever returning. The hotel needs to update it's rooms before we return. I would definitely look around before booking this one. Giant disappointment!!!

Reviews.Title: “great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: 87vacation
Reviews.Content: The Dunes Hotel was in a great location. It was two blocks from the boardwalk. All rooms were ocean view. The rooms were clean. The hotel had large parking spaces as well as plenty of available parking. The lobby had a victorian feel with a large grand piano. The hotel also provided coffee in the morning, as well as afternoon tea and cookies. The hotel had a large deck with rocking chairs that overlooked the dunes and the ocean. The work out room was small, there were three pieces of equipment in it. The pool was okay. It was half indoor and half outdoor pool. There was only two elevators for this hotel, so at certain times of the day it was difficult to get an elevator. We tried to check in early but were unable to. Check in seemed to begin at exactly 3 PM, a long line of people formed at the desk to check in at 3pm. I have stayed at more expensive hotels in ocean city and feel the Dunes Hotel was a good value compared to the more expensive hotels in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, with unexpected amenities”
Reviews.Author: joanie1123
Reviews.Content: We just stayed for four nights at the Dunes Manor with our grown son and his girlfriend (in an adjoining room). The hotel was very nice, and the extra touches definitely lifted our stay here above the ordinary. Coffee served each morning in the lobby, crumpets with butter and marmalade and cookies with hot or iced tea in the afternoon made the atmosphere friendly, as did a pianist each evening. We had trouble with our TV for two days, and the microwave oven didn't work. However, repairs were made on the third day, and the staff was courteous and attentive. The biggest appeal was that all rooms have ocean-front balconies overlooking the beach, which is kept in pristine condition by the city. It was a pleasure sitting on the balcony, just watching the waves come in, and the kites bouncing in the breeze. The biggest downside to the hotel is not enough elevators. There are two, and often, the doors opened to reveal that the elevator was packed with people. Getting an elevator sometimes took 5 to 10 minutes. If we were to return, we would request a room on the 3rd floor, so that we could use the stairs. The location was convenient and we had no trouble finding good restaurants or fun things to do in the area. Definitely a good choice if you're planning a stay in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Quiet and relaxing hotel in a city full of hits and misses.”
Reviews.Author: snupdoug
Reviews.Content: In my mind Ocean City has always had a bit of a reputation as a party beach, but The Dunes Manor Hotel is a quiet and relaxing retreat that keeps the hustle and bustle of the boardwalk and nightlife at bay, but still easily accessible. I stayed here with my family a couple times back in the late 90s/early 2000s. When we decided to return to Ocean City last year after almost a decade, we decided to try it out again based on our great experiences in the past. I'm happy to report that little has changed. Yes, the rooms are small and could use an update, but they are clean, comfortable, and more than adequate. All rooms are oceanfront with a nice private balcony. Look straight out and see people playing on the beach, boats going by, and occasionaly maybe even a few dolphins playing near the shore. Look to your right and you can check out what's going on down at the boardwalk which is just a block away. For you boardwalk fans, here's a tip: walk the one block to the beginning of the board walk and take a cheap tram ride all the way down to the other end (the busy end). Then take a nice long walk back, stopping at all the great shops and snack places along the way. By the time you've walked all the way back and are exhausted, you're right back at your room where you can pass out for the evening. Perfection. What really sets this hotel apart are the public areas. I don't know of another hotel in OC that offers anything quite like it. A beautiful lobby with comfy seating and panoramic windows with an amazing view of the beach and ocean where they serve complimentary morning coffee and afternoon tea, cookies and crumpets. A terrific litte bar/louge and a casual restaurant flank either side of the lobby, both with the same magnificent view. Just off the lobby is a massive oceanfront deck with rocking chairs and potted plants. The bar and restaurant also have seating that spills out onto the deck if you'd like to sit outdoors. There is also a beach level bar that serves drinks and light lunch items. If you get back to the hotel after a night of fun but aren't quite ready to pack it in, you can grab a night cap at the bar and there are nightly piano players in the lobby you can have a sing-a-long with. My parents really enjoyed this. As far as people on here saying the staff was rude...I really can't say I've noticed. Maybe they just caught someone having a bad day. I mean, they aren't in your face bending over backwards to help you, but they are certainly there when you need it. They are pleasant, friendly and willing to fix any problems that might arrise. Last year the soap dish fell off the wall while my dad was in the shower. We told the front desk on our way out to dinner and it was fixed by the time we came back at night. There is also ample free parking. I didn't use the wireless interent the last time I was there and haven't seen anything about its quality on here yet, but we are going to be staying here again in a few weeks and I plan on trying it out with my laptop. I'll report back on my experience. Bottom line: this is an amazing hotel. It's not incredibly fancy or modern, but can certainly provide a peaceful and relaxing getaway. I doubt you'll be dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “You'll work too hard!”
Reviews.Author: Linda0813
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dunes Manor with my family. It was one of the worst experiences ever. The hotel staff was absolutely rude! There was no one to carry our bags and I then became the bell hop. The first room that we were checked into was absolutely dirty and I then asked for another room. Cleaner but not up to standard. I only stayed one night at this resort as that was plenty...then I checked out!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: clpnl
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a few nights at the Dunes Manor Hotel in Ocean City, Md. It was our first trip to the area and after doing some hotel research online, we chose Dunes Manor. Turned out we picked a great place to stay. The hotel is only one block off the quiet end of the boardwalk, so it's convenient to get to without driving and yet you still avoid the all-night noise of the boardwalk . All of the rooms are ocean-view with private balconies. They were clean, comfortable and well-equipped with adequate toiletries and towels. The staff was pleasant and accommodating, as well. Another pleasant surprise was the hotel restaurant. While we only had breakfast there, the food was good and the prices were very reasonable, unlike other hotel chains that charge a "little extra". The lobby was exceptionally nice for a "shore hotel" and they served complimentary coffee in the morning and complimentary lemonade, tea and cookies in the afternoon. There is a deck outside overlooking the beach with chairs and an outside bar for drinks and sandwiches. Overall, it was a really pleasant and enjoyable stay and we would definitely recommend it. We plan to try it again the next time we're in town.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: dean029
Reviews.Content: Where to begin, the front Desk clerks are wonderful and very helpful, rooms are very clean, can use a bit of updating but very nice. Restaurant was wonderful everything we had was superb, prices are very reasonable you will never leave hungry TRY THE RIBS AMAZING!!!!!! . The views from the entire hotel hotel are BREATHTAKING.. All and all a great getaway with a 6 year old.. the beach is only steps away aswell as the boardwalk.. Next year we will stay at the Dunes Hotel and every year after that... when i got home i was looking for the tea and krumpets for a snack, guess i have to wait till next year... Don't be a fool stay at the DUNES..... thanks Dunes for a great OC vacation..

Reviews.Title: “Great Motel Near the Boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: Clarisse17
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dunes Manor Motel this past weekend. I want to say that the staff is outstanding, the rooms are clean and it is the perfect location. The staff went out of their way to help me with my accomodations before my arrival and treated me even better once I arrived. I have absolutely no complaints about my stay. For the past 20 years I have always stayed at condominiums when visiting Ocean City -- no longer. I will be staying at the Dunes Manor Motel for my future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best”
Reviews.Author: Pittsburghfun
Reviews.Content: You can't find a better hotel in OC. The hotel is clean and the staff is friendly. Location is in the middle of everything. could not had a better stay.

Reviews.Title: “First Time Stay at the Dunes Manor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wilsocks
Reviews.Content: My family and I enjoyed our stay at the Dunes Manor Hotel. The service was good, the staff was very friendly and helpful with directing us to hot spots and dining, Doorman were a very nice touch, always there to open a door as well as being very polite. Our room was nice, clean, windows and balcony made room well lit. The bathroom shower water pressure was awesome. Our room was a little smaller than expected. The microwave was small and old, some tiles in bathroom were cracked, the tv reception was not so good. Minor things that caught our eye, but didn't affect our comfort level. The location was excellent, one block from the boardwalk, you feel like you are in the middle to either North or South of Ocean City, without having to drive far distances either way for anything. We enjoyed the rocking chairs on the deck, as well as tea and crumpets between 3 and 4 pm everyday. Pool was half inside and half outside, which was nice because it shielded you from the sun when it was very hot. Never had a problem with parking. Overall we had a very pleasant experience and would definitely consider staying there again next summer.(we stayed 8 days).

Reviews.Title: “The Dunes Manor--Bed linens & bath towels not fit for a prison!”
Reviews.Author: EarthyBarbara
Reviews.Content: Over the years, we have stayed at The Dunes Manor Hotel in Ocean City, MD, at least a couple hundred times. We have also watched the hotel deteriorate over time. Specifically, the hotel management is cheap. Just ask any of the hotel employees and they will tell you how the management refuses to improve hotel accommodations. Specifically, I refer to bed linens and bath towels. The Dunes Manor has been using the same bed and bath linens for as far back as I can remember. The same thin, worn out yellow blanket on the beds which does not keep you warm in winter. You are lucky to have a contour sheet. If so, the seam edges will be torn, ragged and will not stay on the mattress. The pillows are as hard and flat as man-hole covers. The bath towels are small and worn thin. They are a disgrace and will not absorb water after bathing. The same towels have been used at The Dunes Manor for well over a decade. The towels at the swimming pool are thin and small as a handkerchief. One hotel guest referred to them as "prison towels." That speaks volumes. My advice is that if you are staying at The Dunes Manor Hotel, bring your own bed and bath linens. Another way the hotel management is cheap is that the furniture in the guest rooms has not changed for many years. The furniture is outdated and worn down. The two dining table chairs are very uncomfortable. There is no other furniture in which to sit down. If there are more than two people in a room, bring some extra chairs. Other than that, the hotel rooms are satisfactory and clean. Hotel management -- are you listening?? It's to the point that we seldom stay at The Dunes Manor and have found other hotels in Ocean City with much better and more comfortable accommodations for a comparable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sapphire907
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and was treated really well from the time we checked in until the time we checked out. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The halls were quiet and the rooms were clean and well decorated. The exterior of the hotel was clean as well. The location of this hotel is steps away from the boardwalk and is centrally located near various restaurants and activities. As a resident of MD this was my first time visiting O.C. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel will exceed your expectations”
Reviews.Author: superbowl41
Reviews.Content: The Dunes Manor Hotel starts off by being in an ideal location (one block from the end of the boardwalk). All rooms are ocean front views. The victorian decor in the piano bar lobby gives a very warm comforable environment. It is nice that doormen are always present at the main entrance. The rates are in line with the hotels that are in the area. The Dunes Manor is a step above the others for the same rate. There is plenty of free parking, which you shouldn't take for granted. You are allowed to use the facilities before you check in and after you check out. There is a restroom/changing room by the pool to accomodate you if you are in the before or after your stay stage. The food was above average with a somewhat limited menu. With a pleasant staff and clean rooms and grounds it would be hard for someone not to enjoy their stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: milchick
Reviews.Content: My husband, 4 year old son and I absolutely loved this hotel. All rooms are ocean front. This hotel is on the beach, but one block down is the boardwalk. I have stayed on the boardwalk before, this is my first time picking a hotel on the beach and I loved it so much better. You have the beach and if you want the boardway it's steps away. The hotel was clean, nice rooms, bed was comfortable. We ate breakfast every morning at the restaurant and you could sit outside with ocean view. It was wonderful!!! The staff were wonderful!!! Very nice. My 4 year old had a blast. If you have kids, Fish Tails is the place to eat dinner or lunch. They have a play area for the kids and you get a break. Looking forward to going back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up VERY Clean! Quiet! Comfortable!The Best!”
Reviews.Author: 20Chrissy10
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our Three night stay. Oh I wish I could go back & Do it All over again! This was my VERY 1st trip to Ocean City. The Pictures Of this Hotel do Not do Justice! It Looks HUGE from the out side! Everything was VERY Clean, Everyone we talked to was VERY Friendly! The rooms were VERY Clean when we entered & We Tried to let them Clean when we left! Everything worked that we used (Hair dryer/Coffee pot} The food was AWESOME From theDouble stair case To the Victorian Diningroom, Mortons cafe EVERYTHING was So Clean/ Nice A Classy cafe! ! Food/Drinks Very reasonable! We visited Zippys Lounge the night it stormed, had Pop corn & Nachos & Drinks. The piano Music was very relaxing! Rockers On the porch,The Parrot Tapestry Chairs One of My favorites! I Hope I can come back every summer! I think If you Pick the dunes You will be MORE then Happy :) with your Visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: ts21157
Reviews.Content: I stayed here fr only 1 night with my adult son but would have stayed more if schedule permitted. The rooms are clean, plenty of room, great oceanfront balcony (take a chair or two), and adequate for our needs. Bed are comfortable for the average person. If you like a soft bed, they aren't it. I didn't have any complaints about anything. It's only 1 block off the end of the boardwalk and, as i said before, oceanfront with a big front porch for us non-sand people to sit on and enjoy. We had breakfast in the Victorian room with a special coupon that I bought with the room fee and it was very good. Overall price for the room was comparable with normal O.C prices in season.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Alan P
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay on Monday June 14th to Friday June 18th and it was outstanding. Have tried other places over the years but for the price, you get the best bang for the buck at the Dunes. I love the oceanfront rooms with a fantastic view and nothing but dunes and beach in the front of you. For two days we slept with the new windows opened and heard nothing but waves crashing on the beach. The hotel always seems clean and the staff is always eager to please.That is never a given in OC.The pool area was redone and a great place to relax after a day at the beach. My daughter loves the hot tub. We also love the 3pm tea and crumpets and cookies in the lobby.Such a nice touch. We had breakfast in the restaurant the food was good and the view was fantastic. Piano player at night with many guests singing along also is very nice.All and all another great stay. Always seemed to gravitate back to the Dunes and for good reason you always know what you are going to get. Will definitely will be back for our next trip to OC.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodations, friendly and professional staff, great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Spiritgirl1
Reviews.Content: Traveling with my 92 year old mother, the staff helped with special requests including special housekeeping issues and accommodations. Everyone from front desk to housekeeping and restaurant staff were very skilled and eager to please. Food at the restaurant was excellent, lovely dining room with ocean view. Pianist in lobby in the evenings provided wonderful entertainment. All rooms have balconies with ocean view.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rjmc29
Reviews.Content: I have to start off by saying i have NEVER come home from a trip and wanted so much to post a review about our stay . We just got back from a short stay at the Dunes Manor Hotel fromThurs -Sun from the time we checked in to the time we left i have never been more happy with a hotel , and i usually can find numerous things to complain about but not here ,Hotel is in a great location right across from Jolly Roger Rides,Waterpark , and Speedworld . The beach was right outside the doors .The rooms are all oceanfront with a balcony with 2 chairs on it , The staff was very friendly always there to open a door for you or just ask if you needed anything , We will definatly be returning to this hotel Thank you Dunes Manor for making our weekend so much more special !!

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to the projects.Loud music...”
Reviews.Author: Neal4470
Reviews.Content: Welcome to the projects. Loud music, loud people and a staff ill prepared to take out the trash. I've stayed at Dunes Manor for the last 20 years and it's always been a classy place but no more.

Reviews.Title: “Family travelling with teens...”
Reviews.Author: The_Goonies
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend at Dunes Manor. Had an awesome time! We were travelling with our 3 teenagers, and tried to find a place in Ocean City that would appeal to us all. Because of the time of year (not quite warm enough for ocean swimming), I wanted a hotel with an indoor pool for the kids. Dunes has one, and though not large, it was clean, well-heated, and open to the outdoors. My husband and I had NO desire to be "on the boardwalk," but we knew our teenagers would feel differently. This was the perfect location....a block from the start of the boardwalk, away from the the lights and the noise, but an easy walk for the kids. BEAUTIFUL views from every room, and particularly the large porch deck with many rocking chairs. The Happy Hour at Zippy Lewis Lounge was a great deal...domestic beers under $2, and rail liquors under $3. Nice shrimp cocktail (huge shrimp) for only $4.95, and same for great wings. What we found so amazing were the number of people we talked to who had been there many, many times before...some have been coming for decades. Staff was friendly and helpful, and the service was great. Rooms are a bit small, but we were not there to hang out in the room, so it made no difference to us. The only negative was the wifi was weak and sporadic. If you need to do any work using the internet, you may want to find out if they have any areas with a stronger, more dependable signal....the 9th floor was iffy at best. Piano player at 7 PM...you can sit in a wingback chair in the victorian lobby with a cocktail, listening to the tunes, and looking out at the ocean....WONDERFUL!

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhhhh!”
Reviews.Author: momoo
Reviews.Content: Ahhhhhhhh! That sums up the Dunes Manor Hotel. From the time you park your car, to the time you leave. It's relaxing top to bottom. Pull in and unload on the ground floor then take the elevator to the first floor lobby. So lovely. Everything is always clean and fresh, flowers in the vases, brightly lit, and the personel are always friendly and accomodating. Once you get your key and make your way to your room, the first thing you see is the ocean out your windows. All of the rooms in this hotel are ocean front, so there are no bad views. We didn't get a huge room, just two double beds, but there was a kitchenette and table and comfy chairs and a sofa in the room All were clean and fresh. And of course, there's a balcony right outside your in room door with chairs for relaxing. During each afternoon the lobby comes alive with piano music and they serve tea and crumpets (like a biscuit) and cookies, all complimentary. Take your tea and cookies out onto the white rockers on the beachfront deck and watch the waves. It's only a very short walk across the dune to the beach where you can stick your toes in the Atlantic. In the early evening, the grand piano in the lobby gets used for a sing along for all the guests to join in and enjoy. That's a lot of fun and it doesn't matter if you can't really sing a note. The hotel is very convenient to the boardwalk, only one block north of the end of the boards and the boardwalk tram station where you can hop on (for a nominal fee) and ride the length of the boards to the other end where all of the amusements and rides and arcades are. Then when you're done, hop back on to ride back to the hotel and have dinner at the Victorian Room restaurant inside the hotel. Or take a dip in their pool. It's also very convenient to some great restaurants nearby. We've stayed there many many times and will definitely stay there again. It's one of OC's little gems.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: heysoulsister
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in OC a lot and this is probably my favorite hotel. The room was nice, food was great, and everything was just all around nice. The hotel is quiet and pretty relaxing. Pool was average. I have no complaints about this hotel and I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a place to stay in Ocean City, MD.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Didojen
Reviews.Content: For a beach hotel we found the Dunes Manor to be pretty clean and well kept. Not super spotless but nothing really major to complain about. The rooms and interior could definitely use a little sprucing up (new paint and updating some fixtures would go a long way). The lobby with the piano player and staircase make you feel like you are walking into a grand old hotel. Great ocean views from every room. Overall the price was not completely outrageous but during peak season it is very costly but then so are the most run down places on the beach. We did use the hotel room service one night. Portions were small and expensive but service was quick and friendly. Eat out and save some money. There are lots and lots of restaurants nearby. We did not have any issues with the front desk or bell hops. All were very friendly and accomodating. The hotel is at the very end of the boardwalk, so a long walk to the action (at least a 1/2 mile walk). But there was a shuttle (small fee) only a few steps away. If you are looking for a quiet location on the beach this hotel is nice. If you want to be right in the center of the action look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Road Trip”
Reviews.Author: heavenlyhazell2
Reviews.Content: The Dunes Manor was amazing! All the staff members were extremely helpfull, friendly, & always available. The view from our room was amazing, the ocean is right at your finger tips. Only complaint, the bathroom in our room could use some remodeling.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it. Thank you for a great night at the beach”
Reviews.Author: Beachbum840
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful lobby all decorated for Christmas. What nice people, from housekeeping to reception. I loved looking out at the Ocean. Even the weather cooperated.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service for Thanksgiving dinner”
Reviews.Author: IrritatedinOC
Reviews.Content: For the recent Thanksgiving holiday, I drove my family from Virginia to Delaware to visit my 85 year old mother and take her out to a nice restaurant for Thanksgiving dinner. After the 125 mile trip through heavy traffic to Delaware, then another 50 mile drive to Ocean City, MD, we arrived at 2:30PM at the Dunes Manor Hotel for a 3PM Thanksgiving dinner reservation in the dining room. The men in my family were dressed nicely in jackets and ties, and the ladies wore dinner dresses. We had to wait about 20 minutes before the hotel staff was ready to begin seating the guests for the 3PM service. We were led through the bright dining room lined with windows overlooking the ocean to an adjoining seating area and told our table would be one located behind a solid barrier that blocked all view of the ocean and next to an exit and service area. I immediately objected to the host, but was told that the hotel assigns seating for Thanksgiving based on first-come, first-served (meaning those who call early apparently get the best seats in the dining room). The host explained that moving my family would mean others who hadn't arrived yet would get less desirable seating. At that time, nearly all of the tables in the oceanside part of the dining room were available. This seating system would have been perfectly fine we me had I been told of this "policy" when making the reservation. No doubt, we would have selected another place to enjoy Thanksgiving. I went to the front desk and asked to speak with the hotel manager. After waiting about 10 minutes, the manager arrived and was pleasant, but totally unsympathetic and reiterated the hotel seating "policy." I told her that we had visited the Dunes Manor twice before for Thanksgiving dinner and had a pleasant time while seated near the oceanside windows. I also told her that we would never return again due to the terrible seating location we had to endure. I explained to her that I could have selected any restaurant with a secluded seating, but had chosed the Dunes Manor because it offers a view of the ocean. She seemed totally unmoved. Since we felt captured at that point because finding an alternative restaurant at that late time would have been very difficult, we went ahead and ordered dinner. I spent the entire dinner fuming over the hotel staffs' lack of interest in ensuring their customers really enjoyed the holiday dinner. Instead, it seemed that the Dunes Manor has a system and sticks with it despite customer complaints. The food was average and and the waitress seemed pleasant, but was assigned too many tables as empty drink glasses went unfilled for quite some time. My mother and wife complained little until we departed the hotel, then told me that a salmon main dish one had was not completely cooked (raw in the middle) and the other was disappointed with the average taste of the meal. This experience totally ruined my enjoyment of the Thanksgiving holiday meal. Will I ever reserve a room at the Dunes Manor Hotel? ABSOLUTELY NOT!! Will I ever take my family to the Dunes Manor Hotel again for Thanksgiving dinner? Again, ABSOLUTELY NOT!! Will I ever recommend this hotel to friends and family, or for that matter total strangers, ABSOLUTELY NOT!! I will spend my time and money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Absurb rules”
Reviews.Author: guinn777
Reviews.Content: First of all, the people at the front desk act like you are checking into a Ritz Carlton. They are rude and snobby. Secondly, we packed a cooler for a picnic on the ride down and were told we couldn't take it in the hotel room. In order to make a few extra dollars, you are only allowed to have alcohol form the bar at the hotel. There is sign on the front desk telling you that if beer or wine is found without the hotel label on it, you will be asked to leave the premesis. Crazy!!!! Then when we checked in our room was dirty! I understand there are rools for summer beach hotels....but we were all adults in the party and they treated us like 18 year olds at senior week.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Weekend”
Reviews.Author: mab1057
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a long weekend at the beach and really enjoyed it. The room was nice and clean, the weather was great and the view was spectacular! We usually stay on the boardwalk but really enjoyed getting away from the hustle and bustle. We will be coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Some Sprucing Up”
Reviews.Author: EarthyBarbara
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Dunes Manor Hotel countless times over the past decade and beyond. We always seem to gravitate to The Dunes Manor when staying in Ocean City, MD. The current management is, well, cheap. They cut corners at the expense of the guests. The hotel rooms have not been renovated for many years. Same ole, same ole. I'm sick of looking at the same light yellow blanket on the beds. These blankets provide very little warmth. They are very worn-out and have become thin over the years. I filled out a comment card to this regard, but no change. The mattresses are hard and uncomfortable. You are lucky if you have fitted sheets. Most of the time the mattress is covered with a flat sheet which slides right off when sleeping. You end up sleeping on the mattress. The towels are so-so, thin and somewhat worn. Interestingly enough, a few years ago new windows were installed in the hotel rooms. However, these windows are cheap and very inferior. When you slide the window up, is drops right back down. This can be injurious to a person's hand or fingers. There are no brackets in which to hold the window up. What a waste of money. If the management were not so cheap, better and functional windows could have been installed. The carpeting itself is old and becoming worn-out. The regular hotel rooms are relatively small, comprising two beds, one small night stand, two small reading lights, one TV cabinet with three drawers, a table and two chairs and one floor lamp. That's it! The television is the old-fashioned type (not flat-screen). The walls are thin, so hope for quiet neighbors on both sides and above the hotel room. The sink is located in a small area with a tiny fridge, microwave and coffee pot. The complimentary in-room packs of coffee tastes like battery acid. I can't stomach the stuff. Same is true for the complimentary coffee in the hotel lobby. The room-service menu is extremely limited and expensive. Don't go there. The bathroom is small and generally the toilets have plumbing problems. The room is so small, you can't stand to look out the windows because the bed is almost adjacent to the wall/HVAC unit. You have to look out the glass door with built-in venation blinds or go out on the deteriorating deck to see the ocean. The ocean view is magnificent at The Dunes Manor. Internet service in the hotel room leaves a great deal to be desired. I have never had much luck with connectivity. There is an indoor/outdoor swimming pool and tiny little hot tub which holds no more than four people (two is more like it) and with scorching, steaming hot water! There are only two elevators for this large hotel, so expect long waits especially during the busy season. Good luck getting a bell-cart for your luggage during busy periods. The Victorian lobby is the finest feature of the hotel. Hot tea and stale, store-bought cookies are available at 4:00pm each day. Do yourself a favor and don't bother with the daily "Tea," as it's no prize. The restaurant is so-so, but has a beautiful view of the ocean. That's the main draw card for us -- the ocean view from all parts of the hotel and the wooden porch (veranda) facing the ocean. The rates for these tiny hotel rooms in the summer are ridiculous. That's when we head south for much better, larger oceanfront hotel rooms for two-thirds the price of The Dunes Manor Hotel such as we did at Myrtle Beach, SC, this summer. Winter is the best time to stay at The Dunes Manor to reap the lower rates. They get you on holiday weekends with a 2 or 3 night minimum. Plus, if there are any events in Ocean City the weekend of your stay the rate will be higher and the AAA discount will not apply. I have found the hotel rooms to basically be clean. However, the cleanliness is overshadowed by the old furniture and worn-out bed/bath linens. I would recommend this hotel taking the above comments into consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to do nothing and enjoy it!”
Reviews.Author: JerseyBounce
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for relaxation. We stayed there in early October for three nights, and to be honest, we did a lot of nothing and had a wonderful time. The staff was friendly and efficient. Check-in and out was a breeze. The hotel had two eateries open, the Victorian Restaurant which served breakfast, lunch and dinner, and the Zippy Lewis Lounge which was open for lunch and dinner. We had delicious prime rib in the restaurant one night, the other meals we enjoyed at the lounge, where much of the same food was available. There are dining tables out on the veranda for eating outdoor during good weather. Teatime in the lobby was nice, as was the evening piano entertainment. Sitting in the rocking chairs out on the veranda, watching the fishing boats and dolphins go by was lovely. The beach in this area is great for walking, and we saw many people surfing, surf fishing, kiting and metal detecting. The hotel rooms themselves are a bit smaller than we are used to, but comfortable nonetheless. Our pillows were a little on the hard side, and we wished we had remembered to bring our own from home. Otherwise, all was good.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: girlrock
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I have stayed at the Dunes Manor 3 years in a row. We are never disappointed. The rooms are always clean and they are all ocean front. The hotel has a great happy hour I believe from like 3-5PM (didn't partake in it this year) with some really cheap drinks. I like the options of eating in the main dining room or the bar. Both have different menus and both have the option of sitting outside on the front deck. The front deck also has a bunch of rocking chairs to relax in and listen to the ocean. The staff has always been very kind to us as well. My favorite thing about this hotel is that it is only steps from the boardwalk and tram station. The only 2 cons are that the elevators are extremely slow and are often packed in high season and the pool is in the back/side. The elevators are only a major problem for us when checking in or out with the luggage cart. This year we had to wait a few trips until we could squeeze in at checkout hour (also "everyone is going to the beach" time). We usually avoid the elevators and take the stairs. As for the pool, well it's no big deal. I don't go to the beach to swim in the pool, I go to relax on the beach! I wish they had some kind of rewards program like the Holiday Inn because we'd really benefit from it. I would never stay anywhere else in Ocean City except the Dunes Manor Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Dunes Manor”
Reviews.Author: artnuvo
Reviews.Content: I attended a 3-day seminar at this OC hotel. The hotel is on a nice wide stretch of beach and unlike others, is surrounded mostly by low rise accomodations on the ocean and bay side so the beach is not as busy. Our twin bed room was fairly spacious with what appeared to be a newer bath tub-shower unit than that at our last stay 3 years ago. Beds were comfortable tho not pillowtop luxury. Room and A/C was quiet. Alll rooms face the ocean, include a small frdige and microwave, and complimentary wireless is available but spacey. High tea at 4pm. Shenanigans on the boardwalk has good fish & chips and Brass Balls restaurant on 94th st has good pt bbq.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful oceanfront hotel with a great staff”
Reviews.Author: cjd219
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dunes Manor for four nights during the last week in August. The room rate was very reasonable considering the hotel has all oceanfront rooms just a block from the boardwalk. We found the room to be a bit dated (microwave, vanity area, and bathroom), but everything was extremely clean. My only complaint was that the bed was not very comfortable. The view from the private balcony was amazing and the hotel restaurant was very good. We enjoyed being able to relax in rocking chairs on the porch to admire the ocean and to also have direct beach access with umbrella and chair rentals. The lounging area around the pool was a bit small so it became crowded, but overall it was well maintained and really nice. The afternoon Tea Time was great - free cookies, hot tea or iced tea....and it seemed like guests also enjoyed the piano entertainment in the evenings. I'd highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: racecarracecar
Reviews.Content: -great ocean view -terrace -nice staff -clean -good value i've stayed at other hotels in ocean city and this hotel is better than all of them, there's nothing really to complain about. and the best part about staying here is the fractured prune doughnuts located right outside the hotel...best doughnuts in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Beachfront Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jrsongbird
Reviews.Content: My 89 year old mother and I had a wonderful relaxing stay in a comfortable room with a balcony overlooking the ocean. The room had everything that we needed. Refrigerator, microwave, TV. Air Conditioning, comfortable beds and a great view of the Ocean. The hotel's restaurant had great foot and reasonable prices. Our room rate included breakfast every morning for $10 or less. Omletts, eggs, pancakes, french toast, fruit etc. There was afternoon tea with iced and hot tea, crumpets and cookies. In the evening, there was wonderful piano entertainment in the lobby. There was an indoor/outdoor pool which had some shade and some sun and comfortable chairs and lounges with a bar for refreshing drinks. The hotel was only 1 block from the boardwalk so we took the train into the center of Ocean City. This was our first stay at the Dunes Manor and we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel on the beach”
Reviews.Author: ecityman
Reviews.Content: The service from the moment you arrive till you leave is excellent. Every room has an ocean view and the heated pool is an indoor and outdoor combination. There is a piano player and sing along every night except Mondays and Tuesdays. There is lemon water for guests all day long in the lobby. High tea is at 3 p.m. every day, and they serve iced and hot tea, cookies, and crumpets. A really nice touch. It has a great porch to view the ocean and to congregate with family and friends. It is convienient to the Boardwalk, bike rentals, and the boardwalk tram. Restaurants have good food and drinks. It would be better if it offered enhancements like warm bread/biscuts with meals, better coffee, and more variety. The rooms are comfortable, but the pillows could be more plush. Complementary newspapers are not offered even during season when prices are high.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel....but not exceptional.”
Reviews.Author: KenJ1966
Reviews.Content: Very good location, just north of the Boardwalk. Nice hotel, clean but dated and could use a face lift to the rooms. Still one of the better hotels in the area. Cigarette smoking from others balconies billowed onto ours (non-smoking) most of the time (3rd floor). I am super-sensitive to cigarette smoke though. Despite the smoke, great view! Friendly staff, nice restaurant. Pool was nice but it was on the backside of the hotel. It would have been much nicer if it was ocean side. The kids wanted to use the pool and for me to sit and watch with no view was not fun. Overall, I would still give The Dunes Manor 4 out of 5 stars. We really enjoyed our stay despite the cons mentioned. There are very few nice hotels in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “All the rooms have an ocean view. It was excellent to be there.”
Reviews.Author: SSebnem
Reviews.Content: We have been there for just one night. But it was wonderful to renew yourself. There was always a cheerful and kind bellboy at the door of the hotel. The room was very clean, and also there were everything necessary to live such as a refrigerator, a coffee maker and a TV. All the rooms have ocean view, which is the best of all. It was wonderful to look at the endless ocean from your balcony. The exit to the seaside is thought wonderful. There is a place that you can have a shower or wash your feet to avoid the sand. Then there is corridor that takes you to the elevators after you entered the hotel. It was also nice that it is located at the lower ground, so you do not meet any one from the reception or any one not dealed with the sea. Everything was wonderful. Thanks to the Dunes Manor Hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Not a Delight”
Reviews.Author: flyer131
Reviews.Content: The dream of the founders of the Dunes Manor Hotel would be disheartend to see its tired, worn condition today. While there are a few pleasant features to the hotel, such as the rockers on the porch, the nice restaurant, and the hotel's convenient location, the rooms leave much to be desired. The housekeeping staff obviously does its best to keep the rooms neat. But years of use with no investment in upkeep has resulted in rusting edges, fixtures encrusted with hard water stains, tubs yellowed with time and use and embedded dirt throughout. The room was damp and musty, even though the airconditioning worked continuously, it could not get rid of the dampness. It was an uncomfortable stay that I would not recommend. Surely there is a better caliber of hotel in Ocean City. This vacation was not a delight!

Reviews.Title: “Beats the Hilton down the street”
Reviews.Author: freindobill
Reviews.Content: Staff warm and friendly. Great view. Tea in the after noon rocks. Makes the Hilon lobby look like an airport terminal. The place has a warmth and charm.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Stay - Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: resmith04
Reviews.Content: Used to work across the street at the Jolly Roger (yrs. ago) and always wanted to stay here. This hotel is perfect for Ocean City. All rooms are balcony ocean views and very easy access to the beach. The beach bar is a nice plus. A block to the boardwalk...great location. Staff was very nice and helpful. Indoor pool was surprisingly nice. A stay here is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE THE DUNES”
Reviews.Author: flutmstrjr
Reviews.Content: This is our first time going to Ocean City in the summer, we usually travel during the off season. We had reservations at a Hotel further up on the boardwalk, and we were so disgusted by it that we checked out and went back to our old faithful Dunes. I have been staying at the Dunes since I was alittle girl--so well over 20 years. We usually stay at the Dunes Motel, which is very nice--but the DUNES MANOR is Excellent. The room was clean, and had an ocean front view. The staff was EXCELLENT, very friendly and accomidating. I will never stay anywhere other than the Dunes again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RayboPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: I made a mistake in booking, but the staff really took care of us! The Hotel seems brand new, and is a beautiful place to stay. Victorion decor with very nice furnishings, including piano playing and singing in the lobby! Only steps from the beach, we couldn't have been happier! Restaurant is top-shelf with ocean views.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable OC facility”
Reviews.Author: WaterEnthusiasts
Reviews.Content: I have to try to separate my opinions about Ocean City from my opinions about the hotel itself. We went to OC to be with family. I don't really like OC, and I would not recommend OC to a friend as a vacation destination, but if someone were going to OC anyway, this hotel is a reasonable choice. The location is great -- it's right on the beach, just two properties north of the northern end of the boardwalk (the quiet end). So, you can access the boardwalk without having to find a parking space, but you don't have to deal with all the boardwalk-related noise and congestion at your hotel. For swimming, it is a nice stretch of beach. My problem with just about everything in OC is that the prices are extremely high and the facilities are rather crude for what you're paying. The room at the Dunes Manor was very 1980s, with a worn, tired feel. With taxes, we paid about $400 a night for a small suite -- two double beds (not queens) and an old pullout couch in the other room, with one bath and an unappealing little kitchenette. They only have about three months a year of good business in OC, and it shows in the limited investment in the facilities. For that kind of money, you could have a far nicer room in a major NY, LA or DC hotel. At $400 a night, when you're staying in one of the nicest places in town, and the hotel doesn't even provide beach towels, and everything feels worn and sort of cheap, I am not thrilled. But I don't want to single this hotel out for criticism -- it is typical of what I don't like about OC in general, and not unique to this hotel. That's the market in OC. I do applaud the Dunes Manor staff, which seemed more attentive and gracious than most of what I have dealt with in OC. They also see to it that the hotel has more character than most, with a well-known local pianist leading evening sing-alongs in the lobby, complimentary morning coffee, complimentary afternoon tea, and lovely rockers on a veranda overlooking the beach.

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't have asked for a better place”
Reviews.Author: GinnyQWaterburyCT
Reviews.Content: The DUnes Manor is probably one of the nicest hotels in Ocean City. All rooms are ocean front and have a private balcony. The stff couldn;t have been more helpful!

Reviews.Title: “A WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE/GREAT FOOD!!”
Reviews.Author: hevyn
Reviews.Content: We came down from New York for a few days with another couple. We did not have reservations, but liked the location/looks of the Dunes Manor Hotel. With so many choices, we were glad we found this place at a "relatively" fair price. (Frankly, most boardwalk hotels seem ridiculously overpriced for this economy.) The warm & welcoming feeling of the lobby was a surprise (not the glass and chrome coldness of some others in the area.) We loved the decor, very lovely - and of course the priceless view. The Victorian Room Restaurant was another wonderful surprise! We were going to go out, but are so glad we stayed and ate there! Each of us had something different, but every meal was outstanding. The Chef on both Friday and Saturday nights sure knew what he was doing!! Our food was fabulous, and excellently prepared just the way we asked! We were so glad we opted to stay in the comfort of the hotel. We will definitely be returning!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in OC”
Reviews.Author: alleycat2334
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to take our one year old daughter to the beach for the first time on fairly short notice. We found the Dunes Manor and couldn't beat the price. We went expecting just another hotel and found out that if we really wanted we didn't really have to leave the hotel during our entire stay. There are a few options for dining located right in the hotel serving breakfast, lunch, and dinner. We were happy to find that this wasn't the type of hotel that put up partying high school/college kids. The hotel was quiet enough for our daughter to sleep without having to worry about her being awoken by people being loud in the halls at all hours of the night. We were also pleased with the outdoor bar/restaurant as we were able to grab some lunch and eat on the beach and not have to worry about hauling all of our stuff up off of the beach. The hotel is located one block north of the boardwalk which we found to be quite nice, all of the boardwalk fun without all of the boardwalk traffic right outside your room. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “checked in checked out”
Reviews.Author: sammi03
Reviews.Content: i would not recommend this hotel.. checked-in room was small considering the price...pool was small and "green" could not let the children swim. family members found the bar maid at the outside bar rude and unprofessional..after speaking with the manager about these issues we decided to check out immediately . Found another hotel more modern less expensive with great amenities extended our stay for an additional 2 days. I agree with the review written by roxi06 from nj...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful from a far, but far from beautiful”
Reviews.Author: roxi06
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at another hotel in Ocean City but was so impressed with how visually impressive the Dunes Manor was that I thought I would give it a try. This turned out to be a terrible idea. The pool was absolutely disgusting. The water was green and had a foul smell. Couple that with the nasty pool attendant who kept questioning everyone as to what room they were staying in. My question was who in their right mind would want to sneak into this pool? After finally checking into the room, another ordeal I will spare details too, I was greeted to a tiny room with a moldy smell. The toilet had a stain in it and the sheets looked like they hadn't been changed. I was already considering checking out when I tried to get a drink at the empty bar and the bartender made it seem like I was annoying her. I walked to the bar off the beach and was treated to the same rude treatment. I honestly was considering if I was on candid camera at this point. I couldn't wait to leave so I did and checked into another hotel. Try it if you want, but definitely cheaper hotels that are far superior nearby.

Reviews.Title: “wow what a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: peonyflower
Reviews.Content: we started out 4 nights at the hilton and decided last minute to stay 2 more nights but didnt want to pay hiltons exorbitant fees. we stumbled onto this hotel and stayed the weekend. it is very quaint and somewhat nostalgic. very old fashioned basic but beautiful with its victorian theme. the lobby had a pianist that was beautiful to listen to. several bars. the best was the multi-tiered deck with rockers overlooking the ocean....breath taking. you really felt at home. the rooms were basic but i loved how you could open the windows with screens and hear the roaring ocean/what a balcony view as well-i was just very surprised how much i liked this place! i felt like my heart could belong there...not at the hilton! dont get me wrong the hilton is NICE but something about this place...we will be returning! oh and the heated pool is cool also with a hot tub...we had a great time

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting room - does housekeeping even clean this place???”
Reviews.Author: Thrillrider
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dunes Manor over President's Day weekend for one night. This hotel looks quite nice from the outside, and the location is fantastic - right at the end of the boardwalk. However, the rooms and housekeeping here leave much to be desired! We checked into our non-smoking room and the whole room smelled as if someone had just smoked a pack of cigarettes in there moments earlier. I pulled off the comforter on the bed, and the blanket/sheets definitely did not look as if they were cleaned - they were absolutely filthy with hairs (the kind you REALLY don't want to find in a bed) and who knows what else. I called the front desk for a whole new set of linens as well as a new blanket. So we made the bed ourselves, and in the process found a dirty hair curler on the floor next to the bed - gross! The hotel has only two elevators that service the entire 11 floors, so it must take forever to get around in the summer. The only good experience was the view from the room, and the breakfast in the restaurant was very good as well. Not recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: caltone
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Dunes Manor on August 24th & 25th and had great stay! This is not a five star hotel. But the rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. The bathrooms could use a makeover, however. But having an oceanfront room and balcony made up for the bathroom. The staff (with one exception) was wonderful, great service thru out the hotel. We had breakfast in the restaurant each morning and it was very good. Also enjoyed the rocking chairs on the deck. The hotel is in a great location, just a couple of blocks from the boardwalk and right on the beach. You can rent chairs and umbrellas right on the beach. The umbrella was $15 for the day, not sure how much the chairs were. We got some snacks from the bar one day and it was pricey, $3 for a small cup of fries and $4 for hot dog. The only negatives during our stay was (1) the ice machine on our floor was broken and (2) the pool attendant was rude to us when we asked her how to get to the beach from inside the hotel. Overall, we enjoyed ourselves and we would definitely stay there again if we go back to Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DMorrow611
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the Dunes Manor Hotel. We stayed there Labor Day weekend. Pros: The resort is very impressive from the outside and is located in a great location. All of the rooms are ocean front. The food at the Victorian Restaurant was very good. We ate breakfast and lunch there. Portions were a nice size and the food was delicious. The afternoon tea & cookies was also a nice touch. Cons: The inside of the hotel needs some major renovations. The rooms are old-doesn't look like they were ever updated...however they are clean which is a plus. I wouldn't even step foot in their so called indoor-outdoor pool. The pool is old and half of it is inside and the other half is outside. In closing- I really don't think it was worth $250 a night because of the room. But we did have a good time at the Dunes Manor Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay at the Dunes”
Reviews.Author: YPayne
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dunes Manor a few years ago and had a very nice experience so I returned this year. I paid over $300 for my room in July and I truly believe the rate was too high. It should have been closer to $175. Negative comments: What I remember most is that the ice machine on my floor was out-of- order for my entire stay. I lost at least two hours of my stay going to get ice because the elevators were so slow. The microwave in the room looked twenty years old and the refrigerator was off when we arrived. This did not make me happy since I was traveling with milk for my toddler. The headboard rails were dusty and the comforter had snags. The sink took forever to drain. The hotel looks very dated inside. Don’t let the outside fool you. A renovation would help. Positive comments: The hotel is in a good location, it’s near the boardwalk and has a great ocean view. The on-site restaurant still serves a nice breakfast. The front desk staff was friendly. It is not the most horrible hotel I have visited but I will not stay here again for $300. I just can’t justify the price.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend the Dunes Manor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: auntizzy
Reviews.Content: Hotel is good value for the money. I found the hotel after reading other Trip Advisor reviews and found them to be accurate. The rooms are basic but good. The bathrooms, however, are a bit shabby. The real charm is the lobby and large deck on the ocean. There are rocking chairs on the deck for guests to use and it's a nice feature. The hotel is about a 100 feet from the beginning of the boardwalk. I loved the location. Customer service at front desk and restaurant were also good. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Umbratikus
Reviews.Content: The Dunes Manor is a superior hotel. My wife and I already decided that if and when we return to OC, we will stay here. The amenities are great, the food good and comparably priced. With a “happy hour” everyday from 2-7 with half price drinks and appetizers, we never really would have to leave the hotel, if we didn’t want to. Good coffee is available gratis every morning and they serve free tea (hot or iced) and crumpets (and cookies) in the afternoon. The large veranda has rocking chairs overlooking the ocean, and they have one outdoor bar, one indoor/outdoor bar, and a nice white tablecloth restaurant, with some outdoor seating, serving breakfast/lunch/dinner. The room was nice and clean, with a small refrigerator and microwave, and an ocean front deck (all rooms are ocean front). The indoor/outdoor pool is on the small side, but I never go to the pool at the beach anyway. The hotel is only 2 blocks north of the boardwalk, too. One nice unavertised feature is they have a small parking garage on the north and south sides of the building. They were always nearly empty even when the lot was full, so we parked there everyday. The south garage has a door that opens right by the elevators. Nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at Dunes Manor”
Reviews.Author: travelfan04
Reviews.Content: The Dunes Manor Hotel is in a great location. Beach front but a few blocks from the start of the boardwalk. Close to restaurants, mini golf, etc, within walking distance of the boardwalk. The hotel is nice, but a bit outdated. The room was clean but smaller than we expected for the price, though it did have a beautiful ocean view. Balcony was a plus! Bathroom is tiny and vanity area is even tinier. No area in the room besides the vanity for more than one person to get ready to go out b/c there are no outlets near mirrors.Towels are small and paper thin. Beds are very uncomfortable-hard mattress and even harder pillows. Did not sleep well in these beds. Went to the hotel's restaurant, only for breakfast a few times and each time it was good. Eating out on the deck was great. As someone else said, the elevators are slow most of the time. Beach is beautiful and does not get overly crowded in front of the Dunes. Umbrellas and chairs for rent are expensive but available on the beach. Overall, the staff was very friendly. The location is great and the hotel while older looking, is a good option to be on the beach. We would stay there again if they updated the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Dunes Manor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyTrailsNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a great stay at The Dunes Manor Hotel in Ocean City MD. While the room was pretty basic the hotel itself had plenty to offer such as a large Verandah with rocking chairs overlooking the ocean, Victorian style decor in the lobby area, complimentary coffee in the morning and complimentary tea/iced tea & cookies/crumpets in the afternoon. We had great breakfasts at the Victorian Room Restaurant. The entire hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Just steps away is a beautiful beach which offers umbrella/chair rentals. Only 1 block away is the Boardwalk where you can catch a tram to the Pier amusement area. Only 2 blocks away is a Jolly Roger Amusement Park which includes Splash Mountain & Speedworld. A great, but pricey, dinner option is Harrison's Harbor Watch at the South end of boardwalk, overlooking the inlet. A great day trip was a visit to Assateague Island National Seashore. We parked at the North Ocean Beach lot - about a 1/4 of a mile walk south we were able to see the wild horses. When I go back to Ocean City I'll definitely go back to The Dunes Manor.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Tbear790
Reviews.Content: Very Clean. Pool was Green...they need to do somthing about that...Otherwise very nice hotel and great service. Will return. My daughters loved the afternoon tea time!

Reviews.Title: “Sill nice, but cold use a few changes”
Reviews.Author: MaggiMac
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at he Dunes Manor (not to be confused with its sister property, the Dunes, next door) several times over the last nine years; it's hard to beat the location right on the beach, and just off the boardwalk by a block (a good thing, since it's an easy walk but has no boardwalk traffic). The huge porch off the lobby with rows of rocking chairs and tables is one of the best features. You can get a drink at the bar or coffee from the lobby and sit out right over the surprisingly quiet beach. The staff was friendly and helpful, the restaurant has good food, and the lobby is nicely decorated (if that matters to you at he beach). That said, the rooms could use a little updating: our bathroom door was broken and hard to shut. Some slightly nicer furniture on the balcony (even resin or sturdier plastic) would be in keeping with the $280/night price tag. The first day we were there, we had no cleaning service -- they came at 2 p.m., but we were back in the room for lunch. The front desk asked if it would be okay to clean after 4 p/m. when the night staff came on, and we agreed, but when we came back at 9 p.m., they hadn't been there. We finally asked them just to take out the trash and bring clean towels, which a nice young man did. After that, the room was cleaned on time. I agree with a previous reviewer about the pool - it is small and it is not two, but one pool, where half is inside and half outside, but who really needs a big pool when you are right on the ocean?
