The hot tub is small -- wish they'd enforce a rule about young children monopolizing it. :) The hotel just needs a little spit and polish -- new carpet in the rooms, a little new paint. There is a small refrigerator in the room and a microwave, but table /counter space is limited. And above the 6th floor, the internet is too hard to get due to a different service up there. I ended up going to the lobby, though a nice man named Fred tried his hardest to make the wi fi in the room work. That said, the Dunes Manor is still one of the best places to stay in Ocean City. The other, newer places mentioned --like the Hilton (which is nice) or the Grand (also nice) -- are in the $420/night range on weekends. For the price, and the view and the balcony, and the helpful staff, the Dunes is a good value in OC.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay iin OC”
Reviews.Author: aprilg1981
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in OC and we loved it. After reading many positive reviews of the Dunes Manor Hotel, we booked two nights in May. It was a very clean hotel. We enjoyed our balcony on the 10th floor and there was a great view!! It was very quiet (which was good for us). The weather was cold but we were able to swim in the heated pool and soak in the jacuzzi. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed it!”
Reviews.Author: pafuri
Reviews.Content: The Dunes may be a little away from the action - on the very edge of the boardwalk and a mile or so from anything, but really that's the only negative. Personally I loved the old world charm of rthe hotel. We stayed in April, a 2 queen room. The place was spotless, and the view to die for. The room is well appointed, and certainly not in need of refurbishing. The little balcony was great ( though the weather didn't co-operate!) We had both lunch and supper in the hotel, and again found everthing to be great. Staff are excellent, attentive and sociable. We got a great rate off hte hotels website by the way, so check it out before booking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Laid Back Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shelshoc9
Reviews.Content: We use the offseason to try hotels that we would never be able to afford in the summer. This hotel was very nice - clean, friendly, good location. Every room in the hotel faces the ocean so you can not beat the views. TIP: I think that if you were younger and looking for an exciting hotel that the Dunes would not be the place to book. I think that they cater to an older crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: rtbabb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 2/2/08. I can't really add anything to the other positive reviews - it's simply a TERRIFIC hotel! I stayed here 12 years ago and it's just as lovely as it was then. The beauty of the hotel and its amenities, as well as its ocean front location, simply can't be beat in OC. The only negative, as noted before, is that it's too expensive during the summer. Saturday night's rate was $87, including all taxes and fees. The same room is ~$300 in the high season. You can rent a condo or a small house (non-ocean front) for a week at the same price. However, if you're looking for a special off-season get-away, I'd highly recommend the Dunes Manor!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fearslady
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was impeccably clean, had a wonderful unobstructed view of the ocean via the large window and/or the private balcony. The room included a mini fridge, microwave, and coffee pot, two double beds that were fairly comfortable....a decent hotel room for the fabulous off-season price of under $50 per night. I loved the expansive porch off the back of the first floor...complete with wooden rocking chairs, tables, a perfect spot for watching the waves crash on the shore. I did not eat at the restaurant or order from room service, but did help myself to morning coffee down in the lobby. One interesting thing is that you can have a pint of Ben & Jerry's delivered to your room but I don't know at what cost. The only point of complaint is that I could never afford to stay at this hotel if it were not the off season, as it is very expensive in the summer. If I were to visit OC then, I would try to book at the Shoreham Hotel on 4th Street & the boards....it's about $130 a night even in the height of the season.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay year after year!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingCubsFan
Reviews.Content: Every year I am amazed at how clean and well-kept this property is. The rooms are all oceanfront with breathtaking views. Also, each room features a fridge and microwave. The decor of the rooms is bright and airy. There is a swimming pool that opens up to the outdoors (even in the winter). It's neat to swim outside with the steam coming off the water. Inside there is a hot tub. The lobby, restaurant, and bar are all oceanfront. Also, there is a deck running the entire length of the hotel in the back with rocking chairs. It's very relaxing to sit on the rockers watching the surf. In the afternoon, the lobby opens up for tea time, and on the weekends, the sound of Shirely at the piano fills the lobby in the evening. I have always highly recommended this hotel. Consider going in the winter when it's less crowded in OC. The ocean is still beautiful, the rates are low, and daytrips to surrounding towns such as Berlin are easier to take.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, great service, great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Brian F
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a night in October 2007. This is one of the nicest hotels that I have ever stayed in. From the moment that I called up to make the reservation to the moment that we checked out, the staff displayed a professionalism and commitment to service that is sorely lacking in many hotels. The hotel is right on the beach, all the rooms are oceanfront with balconies. Its a block from the boardwalk and has a restaurant on site. We would not have stayed here if it had not been for the person answering the phone at the nearby Rodeway Inn. We had resigned ourselves to staying there. I called the Rodeway up to make a reservation and was told by the person that "we did not need a reservation". I tried to explain that we were traveling from out of state, but the person hung up on me. Besides being very rude, it told me all I needed to know about the Rodeway Inn. Its also pretty stupid from a business standpoint. If you have someone who wants to make a reservation during the slow part of the year, its generally a good idea to take it. I avoided calling the Dunes Manor at first because when I looked on the various online sites, the rates were high. I looked at the Dunes Manor's web site and the rates were comparable, if not cheaper then what other hotels in the area were charging. My wife compared the Dunes to a bed and breakfast. I agree. Its a big hotel with a small town feel. We cannot wait to come back to the Dunes Manor Hotel. I feel very comfortable recommending this hotel. You will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice getaway hotel”
Reviews.Author: drew16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dunes Manor for an extended anniversary weekend, overall we really enjoyed our stay. Here are our pro's and con's Pro's~ the location is great. hotel is very clean and rooms are comfortable w/ a mini fridge, coffee maker and micro. Balconies offer great view (we were on 11th floor), all staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. Pool looked nice (is onside/outside pool) although we did not use. Afternoon tea is nice touch. Con's~service in the Victorian room is slow. We were not allowed to bring in any alcohol in the hotel. My husband was carrying a 6pack of beer and was stopped at the front door. It was no big deal, but that was the 1st time we had ever encountered that at a hotel. The only other thing that we encountered that wasn't exactly positive was the fact that the hotel was hosting a wedding on the weekend we were there. I wouldn't have assumed that would be an issue however it was. The wedding guests practically took over all the public areas of the hotel. We were looking forward to coming in off the beach and enjoying afternoon tea on the porch and when we returned to the hotel, we found the lobby to be crammed with wedding guests also enjoying tea (was to be for guests only) and the porch. We felt that as guests we should have been able to enjoy the hotel that we paid for. We felt that as the wedding had a buffett/bar/snack area set up on the end of the porch, the guests should have been ushered into that area. Obviously the hotel was enjoying the extra$$$ they were making on the tons of drinks that the guests were buying at the bar. We did attempt to snag 2 chairs on the porch to enjoy the sea view only to have wedding guests come stand directly in front of us to take photos of the same sea we were attempting to enjoy. Not the hotels fault that the wedding guests were without social tact, but they could have minimized the crowd by having them use the areas set up specifically for them. Didn't by any means ruin our time, but it was fairly annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Great palce to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: pnorris
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay! The Dunes Hotel is very clean, staff is very nice, and the ammenities.. a wonderful plus. We read many reviews before going about other hotels down the street and were skeptical. Many were rated with bug comments. We were delightlfully surprised by the kind hospitality shown to us in a very busy touristy city and the cleanliness of the room and the whole hotel. Give this place a try you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: famvac04
Reviews.Content: The Dunes Manor is an excellent hotel in Ocean city. The location is perfect directly on the beach and 1 block from the start of the boardwalk. The hotel is very clean which is not easy to find in ocmd. Has a wonderful place to eat with an ocean view inside or outside. The staff was very curteous and friendly.For the same price as average hotels in ocmd you cannot go wrong with this one!

Reviews.Title: “Roaches !!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: crisco250
Reviews.Content: All I have to say is ROACHES!!!!!! Hundreds of them we stayed on the 1st floor Oceanfront at the DUNES MANOR MOTEL ...... Just they worst place we have ever been they room seemed to be clean until we came back at night and went into the kitchenette and on the floor were hundreds of ROAHES.......OH MY GOD ..... W packed up and left that dump..... NEVER stay there ......for $200.00 a night it should have been insect free......totally ruined our vacation....

Reviews.Title: “loved the dunes manor ocean front 10 th floor”
Reviews.Author: dehil1952
Reviews.Content: fantastic, very clean, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Vacation Choice”
Reviews.Author: oceangoer
Reviews.Content: Sept 2007 Just returned from our first visit to Ocean City. What a GREAT choice in Hotel's. Wagih , the manager, was always around making sure everything was ok. You could tell he really did care. The piano singalong was great. We stayed till 11 pm singing and having a great time. Ocean view can't be beat from the rocking chairs. The 3 bartenders at the Barefoot Bar were so much fun. They are hard workers but new how to tell a joke or two and were nice to all their customers. Can't say enough good about them. Happy hour at the hotel is a good deal. Location 1 block from the Boardwalk is a real plus. Good dolphin watching from the deck at the Hotel. Easy to walk to lots of eating places. Food a the Hotel is good also. Tea and crumpets served daily. Always cold ice water available in the lobby. Rooms were very nice. Housekeeping service was very good. We had a great time and will go again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: mommyinmd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary for 2 nights. At $250/night, this place was not what I had hoped for. The rooms are very small (though the view was good). We actually had stained bed linens (not permanent stains), and a toilet that didn't flush! They would not fix the toilet; maintenance claimed that it worked fine. It quite clearly took a half dozen attempts to just flush a single tissue. My husband called and went in person to the front desk multiple times on our second day to try and get the toilet fixed, as using the bathroom in the lobby seemed unacceptable. It got to be very late on our second, and final night, and we just gave up. At check-out, the manager simply said sorry sir. For that kind of money I expect a clean bed, a woking toilet and maybe even a little concern about customer satisfaction. The trip was good, but the hotel was a lousy choice and a huge rip off!

Reviews.Title: “Dunes Manor was great!”
Reviews.Author: Yosan
Reviews.Content: Overall, the best hotel we have ever stayed at. We initially picked the Dunes, after much internet research, because we wanted to splurge and get an oceanfront room for our first stay in Ocean City Md. and the Dunes has all oceanfront rooms. The view is spectacular day and night. It cannot be beat! The rooms are a good size. My family of four fit just fine. Loved the convenience of the coffee maker/microwave/ mini fridge. The room was clean upon arrival and cleaned excellently every day. The pool is on the small side, but it is heated, which was nice. The pool towels are on the small side, but we just used our own beach towels, so this was really not a problem for us. The access to the beach on the ground floor leads through the hosing down area straight to the elevators, which was convenient. There is plenty of parking. It was never a problem, no matter what time we came back. Other reviewers have mentioned the slow elevators. We didn't have any problems at all until we were checking out, but I put this down to so many wanting to use it at the same time because of checking out. The Dunes is convenient to the boardwalk and the tram, only a block away. However, our family found the bus service to be more convenient ,cheaper, and quicker than the tram.The closest bus stop is only two short blocks away. $2.00 for the whole day . It also runs 24/7 every 10 minutes or so, and the tram doesn't run 24/7. The staff was excellent, especially the second shift doorman, who was very sweet to my kids. Our maid service was outstanding. A day or so into our stay, our housekeeper caught on that we were using more coffee and sugar than the one packet she was leaving us(we brought a little of our own from home) and starting leaving us two every morning, without us having to ask. We only ate at the Barefoot Bar, which had good food,quick service and was accessible from the beach. The veranda is a great place to relax and chitchat with other guests. The outside bar was a nice place to get a drink and enjoy the nighttime sea breezes. Other people have mentioned the coffee in the morning and tea in the afternnon. The Dunes also provides ice water with a little lemon all day also. No place is 100% and there is always room for improvement. I wish there was some type of shelving by the microwave/minifridge/ coffemaker area for things like utensils, paper plates, napkins, etc. There is only three drawers in the armoire and two small ones in the nightstand, not enough for a family of four for a week stay. The bathroom is very small, though it does help the sink area is outside of the bathroom. There is only two chairs on the balcony, so we couldn't all sit outside together. I would definately recomend the Dunes and wuold stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service lacking”
Reviews.Author: dadsp33k
Reviews.Content: We just completed our four night stay at the Dunes Manor Hotel on 28th street in Ocean City, MD. From the front the hotel is impressive looking. It resembles a Victorian Castle. The hotel stands 11 floors high and all rooms are ocean front. The inside is nicely decorated in "old ocean city" decora. Each night a lady played the lobby piano and many of the guests would sing old familiar tunes. Our room was nice and clean just as expected. A few complaints. 1. We called down in the morning and asked that our room be cleaned before 12:30pm so that our three little ones could nap before going out for the evening. We came back to our room at 1:30pm to an unserviced room. We called down and got the run-a-round. We asked if it could be done in the evening while we were out. It was. The main dining room is the Victorian Room where we ate dinner, lunch, and breakfasts. The one night we ate dinner at the hotel we were forced to wait 15 minutes for drinks after the order was given. Other than that the food was good. The last day for breakfast we waited a full 15 minutes before being greeted by our server. Our drinks took another 10 minutes and our meal another 20 minutes. In my opinion 45 minutes is way too long to wait for breakfast. There's a good chance that we will return to this hotel because of it's location one block from the boardwalk. I just hope the service has improved.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: chadwickoflaurel
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel after reading the reviews online and being scared off by some of the things written about other hotels. We were delighted by the Dunes Manor. The hotel staff is exceedingly accomodating. Requests were responded to in a matter of minutes. The room was clean and comfortable and without that familiar dank beach-hotel smell. The lobby restaurant is not only a lovely place to have breakfast, but the prices are as good - if not better - than you'd get in many outside restaurants. We ate there every morning because there was no need to go anywhere else. The verandah is lovely and the indoor/outdoor pool small, but nice. Parking was never a problem, even when coming in at ten or eleven at night. The only, very minor, nitpick: wish the tiny mini-fridge in the room had been a little bigger. We would not hesitate to stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: patriotmomof3
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! Been to O.C. many times in the past and this is the cleanest hotel I've stayed out. The room was a good size, EXTREMELY clean (very important to me, as I have small children), has a good sized t.v., coffee pot, hair dryer, refrigerator, toiletries, and plenty of towels and when we asked for more - they gave them to us without any fuss. The employees were very courteous, the hotel is in a great location (across from the Jolly Roger), beautiful view off of every balcony and so convenient. Every room is oceanfront, they served tea, cookies & crumpets every afternoon, they have someone who plays the piano every evening, there is an onsite restaurant & bar and they even have an outside cafe so that you don't have to get all cleaned up, while out on the beach to go somewhere for lunch or a snack. We had family come and visit us while we were there and it started to rain on the beach, so we asked if it would be okay for our family to use the pool with us until the storm blew over and they told us it was fine. They have friendly doormen & bellboys and plenty of parking. I will definitely, without a doubt, return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: furlerfan
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel! It was one of the cleanest hotels that I've ever stayed in. It even smelled fresh. The room wasn't huge, but was plenty of room for 3 of us. The service was excellant. We enjoyed eating breakfast out on the deck in the restaurant. The view was delightful.We will for sure return only maybe next time we will get a suite. A little pricey, but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A Must Stay Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Pixilated
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dunes for two nights while at Ocean City and I will never stay anywhere else but this hotel when I return here in the future. Our room was incredibly clean and comfortable and the view was amazing (we were on the 6th floor). The hotel staff was friendly at the registration desk, at the Victorian room (Milton's on the deck) and at the Barefoot Beach Bar. The location is excellent as well. All rooms are beachfront and it is only one block from the boardwalk. You can take the tram to the opposite end of the boardwalk, walk it back, and be right at the hotel. We didn't want to stay right on the boardwalk, so this was convenient for us. The afternoon tea and snacks was great and so was the piano lady in the evenings. We have one well behaved and quiet child, so this was an excellent place for us to stay because there was not a lot of noise or partying going on. I was sad having to leave and look forward to visiting here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families!”
Reviews.Author: DenaMom
Reviews.Content: Just got back from two nights at the Dunes Manor. This is our third trip to the Dunes. We got to the hotel about 12:30 and the room was not ready, though a few people checking in at that time were fortunate to have theirs availalbe right away. The lady at the desk said she would take our cell #s and call us when the room was ready, and she did 30 minutes later! Very thoughtful. The rooms are a bit small, two doubles, with a small table w/2 chairs. The fridge/microwave are on a shelf in the alcove outside the bath/shower area. One side is the microwave/coffeepot/fridge area, the other side of the hall is the sink/mirror. That way someone inthe shower can have privacy while another primps at the sink area. The rooms are older, this is not the Hilton. But they were exceptionally clean. The maid service was very nice and prompt. Our kids love the ability to go right out the back door of the hotel, through the dunes, and onto the beach. There is a beach chair/umbrella rental stand right next to the walking path, so that is very convenient. At lunch time, just walk right back up the path and onto the hotel deck. Lunch food is typical (burgers, hotdogs, chicken fingers, fries, mozzerela sticks), and a few salad/wraps. We always take this lunch time to get out of the sun for awhile and enjoy the shade at the deck tables. The boardwalk tram station is about 1.5 blocks away. This is very convenient as you can park the car and leave it for the time you are at the hotel. Yes, the tram is 2.75, but buy a card with 10 trips and save a few bucks. Buy it on Friday, as on Saturday the price goes up to 2.75 from 2.50. This is a lovely family-friendly hotel. It's not the Ritz, as I said, but it's definitely one of the best places on the beach for the money. I have been going to OC for 30-something years, and I am always happy with my stay at the Dunes Manor. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: black325
Reviews.Content: Stayed June 26-29th. As most reviewers stated, it is a very nice beach hotel. It is close to the boardwalk, but walkers be aware that it is 3.3 miles before you get to the amusements. The tram ($2.75 one way to drop off or end) took 30-40 minutes to get to that point. Didn't notice any other comments about this, but the water pressure in the shower was great. We paid extra for a corner room expecting to have a two sided view, but the outside wall only had a small window. Disappointed on that item, but having no neighbors on one side contributed to a very quiet room. There are not many restaurants within short walking distance, so we did try the hotel's dining room on the night of our arrival. Food was good and not outrageously priced, but the service was S-L-O-W. We found Happy Jack's Pancake House 2 blocks away and had unusually quick service there. However, breakfast at the hotel was a decent price served in a timely manner. All in all a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Stay in November 2006”
Reviews.Author: Somerdale Gal
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Dunes Manor was good. The front desk staff were very curteous and helpful. The view off the deck is beautiful. The room was a bit small but clean on arrival and cleaned promptly each day. The restaurant and ocean view for breakfast was very nice. I would recommend this hotel to families with young children and older couples. There was not much night life at the property. Although they did have someone who plays the piano in the evening. They also offer afternoon tea every day. The only downside was the pool and hot tub area. They need to do dome work on it. The gift shop is also very small. Other than that we enjoyed our stay and the rate was a good value for off-season. We would stay there again and recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: patravelor
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel in it's day and still could be if renovated. The lobby is nice but the rooms need to be renovated especially the bathrooms. The paint was peeling off of the railing on the porch. Some things that are nice about the hotel are the rocking chairs on the porch, inexpensive happy hour at the beach bar, tea in the afternoon and the location in terms of the boardwalk. A good portion of the staff is foreign and more were coming in for the summer. By far, the best thing about this hotel is the view from your room - can't beat it. Use this hotel as an alternative. The Grand is nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean city in winter time”
Reviews.Author: 3T
Reviews.Content: Our family stay at this hotel during the Christmas Holiday. Everything is relatively quiet, but peaceful. The sound of the ocean is wonderful and the view from the balcony is fantastic, especially at the sunrise. We take a trip to the Asseteague Island and have a nice walk around and see one wild pony upclose and one further away.

Reviews.Title: “Dunes Manor Hotel is no longer worth the summer rates they charge.”
Reviews.Author: FairtoEveryone
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dunes Manor Hotel in July 2005 and found it to be a place of extremes--a mixture of good quality with the very average. The lobby is very nice and spacious with a pleasant old fashioned Victorian parlor theme. You can walk out to the adjacent big porch facing the ocean and sit in one of the many rocking chairs and relax. There is a friendly woman piano player who plays all the old favorites on the old grand piano on some evenings in the summer just like it must have been in the "good old days." There is also, at least in the summer, a daily afternoon tea and cookies which is very popular with the guests. The hotel restaurant is also just off the lobby overlooking the ocean with fairly decent food and service. I did get one of the order by 5:00 pm dinner specials and it was pretty bad though. I made the receptionist take it off the bill when I checked out but only after alot of arm twisting. The breakfasts were fine and a couple other "non special" priced lunches were adequate. The hotel is just one block north of the end of the boardwalk for easy access to the boardwalk tram and attractions. Overall, I was quite disappointed with the room at the Dunes Manor Hotel. The mid-week rate in July 2005 was $239 a night which with tax brought the bill to well over $700 for the 3 nights I was there. The room was tolerable, average size and not awful. However it was very very plain with cheap furnishings and two double beds which were acceptable but not very comfortable. After the nice lobby, the room is a let down. The bathroom was small and also plain. ( My rooms at the Crystal Beach Hotel and the Holiday Inn Express where I stayed in 2006, while nothing special, were both superior to this room. ) You do get a private balcony off your room directly overlooking the ocean which is a plus when staying here. I was up on a higher floor so the view was very pleasant. The room was kept fairly clean and had daily maid service so I have to be fair about mentioning that. Unfortunately my room smelled strongly of urine in a corner of the carpeting as if the people before me had brought a pet dog. The front desk said they could not change the room when I went to complain right after checking in so I went out and bought a can of Lysol which helped as long as I kept spraying regularly. I need to share with readers that the elevators in this hotel are ridiculously slow. They are so outdated for a place charging the rates the Dunes does. After the first couple of times it got very very annoying to wait for them because it seemed to take forever. To the owners of this hotel; get off your butts and replace these elevators. Your customers don't deserve this cheap mediocrity. If you are not going to replace them and update the rooms a little, you have no business charging the rates you do. Overall, one needs to keep in mind, including me, that this is Ocean City, and the overall standard is not like staying at a decent hotel in Baltimore or Washington, D.C. Still, things are changing and there is some competition out there now in O.C. I can say without any hesitation you can definately do better than staying at the Dunes Manor when planning your next trip to Ocean City. The rooms in this place get a B-. They do not get an A - or a B+. Without the direct ocean view balcony they would get a C, regardless if this hotel is located in O.C. It is time for the Dunes Manor to have a facelift, and especially, an elevator lift. Until then, this property will not see any more of my money.

Reviews.Title: “very clean rooms good ocean view good view of the pool and bar area nice deck an”
Reviews.Author: armyman2006
Reviews.Content: Very clean rooms excellent service beautiful view of the ocean loved the view of the inside pool area and the bar nice huge deck and nice outside bar

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Palce”
Reviews.Author: Visitor7
Reviews.Content: Stayed Oct 1st and 2nd Really enjoyed the place - mainly retirees Free coffee in AM (6-10) and tea with cookies and crumpets from 3-4 Very large porch/deck facing ocean with rocking chairs Also has indoor/outdoor bar (also sells food) Main retauarnt - Victorian is very reasonable for breakfast - had a special for 2.99 - 2 large pancakes with sausage or bacon and coffee (didn't have lunch or dinner in restaurant). Indoor pool and on weekends in off-season they have a piano player in lobby. Places to eat in walking distance and Hotel is just few blocks to end of boardwalk (can take tram on weekends during off season) No issues with room - all are oceanfront with good views Only complaints - water pressure in shower wasn't the greatest and no treadmill in exercise room Staff all were friendly and extremely helpfull Found the place quite and very relaxing I will definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay At Dunes Manor Hotel, Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: bliteful
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dunes Manor hotel over Labor Day W/E. The hotel was quite clean and comfortable. The rooms are all oceanfront with a nice balcony. It is close enough to the boardwalk. The check-in and checkout process was hassle free. The price was relatively reasonable. There was adequate parking. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: kakesrules
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dunes Hotel from 8/19-8/26. It is, by far, the nicest hotel I have ever stayed at. The rooms are extremely clean and the housekeeping staff is very good. We stayed on the 10th floor and it was very quiet at night, just the sounds of the ocean. The restaurant is very nice. You can dine inside or outside overlooking the ocean. The food is really good and not too highly priced (for Ocean City). The rocking chairs out on the veranda overlooking the ocean are very relaxing when you want to just stop and sit for awhile. The pool is nice, but very warm. The jacuzzi temperature was quite hot. Shirley Toms plays the piano nights (Wed.thru Sunday) in the lobby. This is a great time for all ages. She has sing-a-longs that are a lot of fun. Doesn't matter if you can sing or not! The lobby, itself, is beautiful. The afternoon "tea" time is fun for all, as well. The only complaints I have were the elevators (only 2) that took a long time to get, and there were a couple of front-desk girls that were not very friendly during our stay. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone going to Ocean City to "party", as it is definitely not the place for that. It is more of a family-oriented, or "mature" traveler's hotel. It is well worth the extra money we paid, and I would go back again if I ever have the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, but not great”
Reviews.Author: sambrose
Reviews.Content: First, a little perspective. While there is a lot of development happening in OC, MD, there are very few really nice places to stay. The Dunes Manor is one of the nicer hotels, but is not luxurious in any way. The rooms are clean, but small and spare. The bathroom is small and basic. There is a small fridge and coffee maker in the sink area. There was plenty of hot water, but the water pressure was very, very weak. The beds are comfortable. The lobby and large porch are the nicest features of this hotel. The location is also very convenient and the ocean views are great. I took my son to OC for a short getaway. I felt that the rate was expensive for one night mid-week, but the room was oceanfront and again, there are limited choices for nicer accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: WVVickster
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay at the Dunes Manor Hotel. I have mixed feelings because I really disliked Ocean City. But if you have to go there, the Dunes Manor Hotel was clean and the staff was very attentive. The elevators were slow, but it is a busy hotel... We LOVED the piano lady Shirley Toms, who plays and passes out song books and there were families singing and older people sitting next to college students and it was great. They have afternoon tea and cookies and that is very popular also. On the down side, their beach stand where you can buy lunch is chaotic with a capital C. We ate breakfast in the Victorian Room and it is affordable. We ate outside and watched the dolphins swim by . All in all, the Dunes was in a great location. I looked around and if I HAD to visit Ocean City again, I would stay at the Dunes again. Nothing else appealed to me....

Reviews.Title: “NIce time for all”
Reviews.Author: A1teacher
Reviews.Content: The Dunes Manor is a beautiful hotel. I travelled w/my cousin, my daughter, and her daughter for a few days away before my cousin's daughter heads off to college. We had a great visit. We did enjoy the ocean front room, what a view!! Dolphins galore. Our room was very nice. The bathroom was a bit small, but functional. We liked having the fridge and microwave. The first day our air conditioner did not work, but it was replaced immediately with no problem. We loved afternoon tea and singing w/Shirley. The four of us really enjoyed the evening she was there. We also like the free coffe and tea in the morning. We sat many afternoons on the deck in the rockers reading and listening to the waves. We also liked the pool. It was clean and comfortable. The price was a bit high, so it will be difficult to stay at the Dunes Manor again, this was a special trip, and we picked the perfect place. While we waited for the elevator, many people complained, but I did not have a problem with how long we had to wait. It is a busy hotel and they have 2 working elevators. The wait is never very long. It is not possible to just press the button and get instaneous results anywhere. I found it completely reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jlaharrity
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to OC and the hotel was great. Clean, well maintained and good service. Excellent location in relation to boardwalk. Just a 2 blocks away! It was also quiet here so if you are looking for a family place and not a party hotel, this is a great place to stay. We enjoyed the "afternoon tea". The hotel was right on the beach. Very convienient so you can just park your car for your entire stay and take the bus or boardwalk tram! If we decided to go back to OC, which we will, I would definantly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “No problems”
Reviews.Author: luv2go
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Dunes Manor. He is currently working on a project in OC that brings him there twice a month. He tried a few different hotels and has not been pleased. The Dunes changed that. The hotel is not 5 star or anything like that, but it beats most typical beach hotels. The rooms were clean, the staff VERY helpful and curteous, and the location was perfect. The only complaint I had was the elevators, they were slow, but that was not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on what you are looking for”
Reviews.Author: jbs1114
Reviews.Content: My family of five and I just returned from a 4 day stay at the Dunes manor. We have family in Ocean City, and they booked the place for us. From looking around the rest of Ocean City, it was a pretty good deal. Most lodging there is pretty sketchy, but the Dunes was clean, beachfront, and affordable. The beach was great, and umbrellas and chairs were available to rent. The rooms were small, but not dirty, and all had great ocean views. The food was typical beach fare, though with waiting times that were spectacularly long. The pool was located far away from the beach, and was nothing special. Final Verdict: Ocean City is a beach town, and that comed with the whole cast of shady characters and establishments that you might expect. The destination itself was not somewhere I can't wait to go back to, but if you're going, the Dunes Manor is no Four Seasons, but it seemed like the place to stay. It was quirky, but eventually grew on all of us. Before you make plans to visit Maryland, consider Montauk, Long Isand if you are in the NE. It far outclasses OC.

Reviews.Title: “classy, clean, and courteous”
Reviews.Author: rossnd
Reviews.Content: My family(wife and 2 teenagers) just returned from our 6 day trip at OC today. It's hard to imagine a better motel- service,price, and accomodations. The hotel looks majestic, and the doorman open the front door for you. Parking is either outside or under the lobby, as ample spaces abound. Courtesy permeates throughout the staff at the hotel(the doorman, front desk, maids, waitresses, and pool assistant). The lobby has a victorian style that is well maintained. Wnen we first entered the room the telltale sign of cleanilness is the bathroom. That's what I checked, and when you can safely place your food on the bathroom floor and eat, you know you have a classy hotel. The room was a decent size, and overlooks the ocean(as do all of their rooms). The only complaint, and it's minor, was the dresser having only 3 drawers for 4 people, but this was overwhelmed by the service and accomodations. The hotel encourages socializing with these nice touches. Happy hour starts at 2(beer is $1.35, mixed drinks $3(virgins) and $4( spiked). Around 3 pm tea and cookies are served for guests. In the evening Shirley Jones plays the piano for sing-a-longs. The pool is moderate size up to 4 1/2 ft depth & is a combo indoor /outdoor, which was perfect for the heat wave, for those avoiding the sun. They have an early riser breakfast special at $2.99(pancake, eggs, etc) , and and early bird dinner special. We tried each and were satisfied. The hotel is owned by a woman, who obviously trains her staff to be courteous and attentive. The view from our room was fabulous. We only wish the humidity wasn't so high, so we could sleep with the windows open and hear the waves crashing on the beach. You'll pay more here than best western or howard johnson's, but your stay will be more enjoyable and without accomodation incident. This is a wonderful hotel, and has a fabulous staff with a pleasant attitude. They enjoyed serving their customers and the sparkle on the bathroom floor reflected that. You'll pay more than the motels, but the difference was worth it to me. Do you want zinfindel or ripple?

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: 3day*walker
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at Dunes Manor. Perfect view, wonderful staff, VERY CLEAN rooms!! Large enclosed area for rinsing sand off when coming off the beach is a plus! Lobby area bathrooms were exceptional! Just 2 small negatives,,,, bedding wasn't very soft and there was a little too much chlorine in the pool. Overall, this is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Dunes Manor was Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Came to dunes manor after reading many positive reviews, we just got back from our stay and were very happy, and now have decided it will be the only place we stay when traveling to ocean city. Location was perfect just mins away from boardwalk so we did not have to deal with all the noise as we would have if we stayed at a boardwalk hotel. The room was great and very clean. could not have asked for better. Great staff and people you can acutally understand. Very Very Pleased......

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: shimlin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Dunes one night. Hotel is very nice, dinner was very good! I was not all that happy with the room itself. The bed was not comfortable and the sheets and bedspread felt scratchy. not comfy at all. I did not sleep well. The shower sprayer was really bad with very little water pressure. The hotel itself was very nice and the view from balcony was beautiful. The room was clean just not comfy. They had a piano player in the lobby at dinner time which was very nice! The porch with the rocking chairs was also very nice. If the beds were better and the shower was better it would be the perfect place!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Dunes Manor Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: spoons33
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Dunes Manor Hotel from 6/19/06-6/23/06. We cannot say enough good things about it. The hotel was clean, the restaurant was wonderful, and everyone was really friendly. There is no such thing as a bad room because every room has an ocean view and private balcony. The hotel is located one block from the boardwalk, which is a good thing if you want a relaxing and quiet vacation. It was a little chilly (by the ocean) during our stay so we relaxed in the well-maintained swimming pool and jacuzzi. We also enjoyed the piano performance by Shirley Toms in the beautiful hotel lobby. She performs four nights a week during the summer. This is the first time we have ever recommended a hotel. We would not hesitate to go back! This is an excellent place to stay at if your looking for a quiet family-friendly hotel. The prices are fairly reasonable considering the hotel only offers oceanview rooms.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service at half the rate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Dunes Manor with my girlfriend and my new born for a family weekend getaway. We had heard good things about the Dunes Manor , but we were not expecting the five star service we recieved. The price we paid was much lower than other nearby hotels we had contacted with the same ammenities. The view was unbelieveable. We could see up and down the atlantic coastline. The sunrise met first thing each morning. Last year we stayed at the Bonita Beach who claimed their rooms were oceanview; it was a room almost two blocks off the ocean with hardly any view. It was a pleasent suprise how elegant the hotel looks as you first enter the hotel. We arrived early not expecting an opportunity for early check in but the people at the front desk were nice enough to contact housekeeping and have our room ready since we explained we had our 3 month old baby boy. We felt secure in this location, everybody was really nice; the food at the restaurant was worth the money ; and the room was extremely clean. I will defenitly come back and make it a family tradition to return each June.

Reviews.Title: “ok but stay away if looking for a younger crowd”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a weekend at the Dunes Manor..... it was ok.. One precaution... the hotel seems to cater to a more mature age set. The first night we were there a representative knocked on our door and stated that they got complaints that we were being too loud(it was only 8:30pm at night and we were talking to our friends out on the balcony??? The room service was so so but very expensive($22 for potato skins and chicken fingers) Bottom line, we had a good time but wouldnt go back again

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for a conference”
Reviews.Author: GigiNYC
Reviews.Content: The Dunes Manor Hotel hosted our Girlfriend’s Conference April 19-21, 2006. An enjoyable time was had by all. The rooms were well appointed and the view..well it was spectacular, to say the least. With all the roms facing the ocean, there wasn’t a bad room in the hotel. The conference space was nice. The room had a window wall that faced the ocean. The staff waited on us hand and foot. We wanted for nothing. Applause to Kaylor, Jessica and Elle! The staff went above and beyond what an ordinary hotel would do. But the Dunes Manor is NOT your ordinary hotel. The food was great. I’m especially partial to the brownies (hint, you should make those available for sale!) The veranda that stretched the length of the hotel was beautiful. You can sit in the rocking chairs and just enjoy the view and it’s a great place to take a date once the sun goes down. And the 3pm daily tea is a wonderful touch. It gives everyone staying at the hotel a change to mix and mingle. There is a small jewelry shop in the hotel with the best prices for the most unique jewelry. I think everyone that attended out conference left with something from that shop. The prices were hard to beat and the stones and styles of the jewelry were exquisite. There was something for every price range. I can’t say enough about the wonderful experience we had. I wouldn’t hesitate to have my next conference at the Dunes Manor Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Positive experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Ocean City for a 2 night stay at the dunes manor hotel for our first time there, even if the weather didn't cooperate with us we did enjoy our stay. I have to mention the service is very good, the establishment in general is very clean and the view from the balcony was spectacular. Definitely staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the dunes Manor!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very comfy rooms. The staff was just awesome. Catered to our every need. Beautiful view from our balcony. Will be repeat visitors!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - but warning - they don't have cribs”
Reviews.Author: travelerBaltimoreMD
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Dunes Manor Hotel over Easter Weekend was a mixed bag. We booked via the Internet and asked for cribs or pack n plays for our young twins. Rooms were booked on Thursday for Friday arrival. Apparently, on Friday morning, the hotel attempted to call us to let us know that they do not offer cribs or pack and plays. Unfortunately, we did not get the message prior to leaving for Ocean City. I had never stayed at a hotel that did not offer cribs, so I had no idea that would even be an issue. We found out upon arrival, and at first we were quite annoyed. However, Armondo, the front desk manager was lovely and very accomodating. He attempted to find us a room at another hotel. In the end, he offered to upgrade our room to a larger suite free of charge and to provide extra pillows and blankets to let the babies sleep on the floor. We wound up doing this. So if you have young children, bring your own pack and plays. Also, if you have children in strollers, be aware that the lobby and the restaurants are one floor up from street level. This is slightly annoying because you constantly have to take the elevator up and down one floor. Because it wasn't that crowded Easter weekend, this was not a big deal, but I would imagine that during peak season, it could be rather time consuming, given that there are only two elevators. I would have to agree with the other poster that the suite is not large and the kitchen is not as well stocked as some other efficiency hotels that we have stayed at. The room was not luxurious but is pleasant. But with that said, there was much to like about the Dunes Manor Hotel. The staff, from Armondo at the front desk, to the wait staff, to the pool attendant, were friendly and gracious. The location is amazing -right on the beach with beautiful beach front views from every room. The balconies were private, so I could sit out, nurse the babies, and watch the ocean. Plus, the hotel is one block from the boardwalk so it was easy to walk with our babies in the stroller. The pool isn't the greatest, but for our purposes, it was fine. We ate almost all of our meals in the hotel, and found the food to be good and reasonable. In addition, there were nice activities, such as the piano player at night and a performer for the kids. Bottom line, we had a wonderful weekend. I definitely would stay here again - in fact, it might become an Easter weekend tradition. It is easy to focus on the negatives, but there was much to like here too.

Reviews.Title: “Suites are a major disappointment”
Reviews.Author: JMSC-92
Reviews.Content: My family have been staying in the regular rooms at the Dunes Manor for years with few complaints. However, because this vacation was going to be somewhat longer than our typical Ocean City weekend getaway, we reserved an efficiency suite. We were VERY disappointed and now are not sure we will ever return to the Dunes Manor. The room was more than twice the price, however, was not even close to being twice the size of a regular room. The bedroom, bathroom, and living room areas were incredibly small. However, worst of all, the kitchen was very poorly stocked (no sponges, colander, dish drainer, etc.) and the appliances were in HORRIBLE shape. Only one of the stove burners worked and the microwave was a dirty and old model from the 80s. The new mattresses and linens were noticed and appreciated, however, they did not make up for the excessive prices charged for probably the worst efficiency I've ever stayed in. I hope management does see this review and renovates the suites. They are a black mark on this otherwise upscale facility.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were really impressed with the view we got from our balcony. It appears as if all of the rooms are oceanfront. Our room was very clean. Every employee we dealt with was very kind and helpful.We did have a good time with Shirley the piano player. She played lots of old fun tunes, it was a grand ol'time. The breakfast in their restaurant was quite delicious. Overall we were very satisfied with the service and definitly going back later this summer even though the rate is a bit higher, i cant imagine a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: ez4shore
Reviews.Content: Rooms are smaller than I'm used to in Myrtle Beach. The Hotel is attractive and clean. The pool environment is wierd; it's situated on a floor/patio very strange ??? Seems like most of the staff are not citizens. But most of the people that were guests are well mannered and not hell bent on getting drunk for a good time. Avoid the on site restaurant, it's OK, but expensive. I'd go back, but the place is expensive for what you get compared to Myrtle Beach.

Reviews.Title: “What a Wonderful World”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Let me say that normally I and my husband prefer Virginia Beach. This year we made an exception. We decided to chose Ocean City Maryland and the Dunes Manor Hotel. After this trip we may not ever return to VA Beach. When we arrived to the hotel and walked in and saw the big open lobby area and the decor, we were truly amazed. It was very elegant and beautiful. We could of used the elevator to go to the front desk but we chose to use the steps because it enabled us to see more of this gorgeous hotel. At Check In the front desk staff was very friendly; particularly the girl who checked us in cassie and the gentleman with her , who i believe must of been the manager judging by how well he was dressed; unable to get his name but a very friendly manager with a great smile and personality. In this day and age we have experianced so much horrible customer service during our travels my husband and I just ate that up. The houskeeping staff was just as friendly. Making sure that all of our needs were met. We did not have a chance to eat at the restaurant but heard very good things about it. Our view from our patio was heavenly. The room was extremely comfortable and very new looking. At night time the hotel itself is very well lit and you can see it from a distance. We were close to several restaurants that had very good food as well. The boardwalk is just a couple of blocks away, where we caught the trolley train to take us to the other end. The hotel itself is in a much quieter area than what we saw downtown. There is so much I could say about this Hotel , but I will end this with a recommendation for a classy hotel this should be your choice, and that if all hotels were like this , what a wonderful world this would be.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare on Wedding Street”
Reviews.Author: SG2355
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I arrived in Ocean City late afternoon on Sunday, September 25. When he checked in, he was told that we were booked two doors down at the Dunes Manor Motel. He came back to the car and informed me, and we proceeded to the motel to find out what was going on. Upon entering the lobby, I asked the desk clerk why we would be booked at the motel, when we made reservations at the hotel on-line. She didn't seem to know what to say except there were no vacancies at the hotel. I then asked to speak to the manager. At this time, she said that he was dealing with another patron and would be awhile. She said that we could look at the room if we wanted to. We did, and I was so angry I couldn't see straight. It was our wedding week (we were getting married on the beach in front of the hotel), and they had ruined our plans. I had envisioned our stay at the Victorian style hotel, and what our wedding would be like. I told my fiance that I would not stay in that outdated 50's motel, when everything was planned around staying at a supposedly very nice hotel. Well, we waited for approximately 30 minutes and still no manager, so my fiance decided to call the Quality Inn Beachfront where we had stayed two years prior. We had a very nice stay there before, and they actually saved the day! We were able to book a suite for the entire week for $50. less than what we would have paid for that outdated motel. The Dunes Manor Hotel makes false advertising claims, overbooks at the hotel, and then sends unknowing guests to the motel. After driving many hours, most guests have no choice but to stay there. Something should be done about this. I hope other people come forward who have had similar experiences with this hotel. Our wedding turned out lovely, with no thanks to the Dunes Manor Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location and a very clean property. Kids, and parents, loved the afternoon tea. Felt very welcomed from check-in to check-out. We ate in the dining room at night, and found it worth the price! Will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Ocean City, if the Hotel Pool is not your First Concern”
Reviews.Author: craigdg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dunes Manor hotel from Aug 28 through Sep 2. This is just after peak season ends, and so I was able to get a corner oceanfront room, with two queen size beds, for $159/night... pretty inexpensive for Ocean City. Note that the Dunes Manor Hotel is constructed such that ALL rooms are oceanfront, and the views are pretty spectacular, particularly from the higher floors. We booked the room online at the Dunes Manor reservations site, and arrived approx 11:00 am on the day of our arrival. Check-in was at 3:00, and, despite our hopes of getting an earlier check-in, 3:00 is about when our room was ready. I do not fault the hotel for this, as 3:00 pm check-in is clearly stated when reservations are made. Now, I have stayed in two other Ocean City hotels in the past, both of them being Quality Inns (or, as I like to call them, Low-Quality Inns). The Dunes Manor hotel is a refreshing change, as we found the hotel to be spotless! Different people look for different things in a hotel, but as for our top-ten list of requirements, cleanliness takes numbers 1, 2, and 3! The Dunes Manor met our requirements for cleanliness; I even joked that I could eat off the bathroom tile, as it was so immaculate! In fact, the room decor is almost entirely white/light colored, in which case it is all the more important to keep things clean, and the hotel appears to keep on top of this. Unlike the Low-Quality Inns I stayed at in the past, I was entirely comfortable walking around barefoot in the room, and sleeping on the hotel sheets (although I ALWAYS remove the Bedspread in every hotel for well known reasons!) Number 4 on my requirements list at a Beachrfront hotel is the pool. I like big, clean, heated pools, preferably on the beach side of the hotel. In this case, the Dunes Manor comes up rather short. They have a combo indoor/outdoor pool on the Lobby level, on the street side of the hotel. The pool is not large, nor is it tiny. The portion of the pool on the "Indoor" side is a little dark and dank. The outdoor portion is definitely more sunny and "cheery". Unfortunately, this pool only goes to 4-1/2 feet in depth, so you can forget about diving. On the plus side, the pool is heated, and it was a pleasant 80 degrees during our stay. I think I would have been a great deal more satisfied with the pool if it had been on the beach side of the hotel instead of the street side. The hotel offers clean towels at the poolside, but they are tiny, like washcloths, so you may wish to bring your own towels, or take the large ones down from your room. There are 11 floors in this hotel, and only 2 elevators. The hotel was not all that busy during our stay, so there weren't too many long waits for the elevator, but I would imagine that during peak season you might wish to call for the elevator several minutes in advance of leaving your room! There is a nice-looking restaurant in the hotel, but we did not end up dining there, so I cannot provide my opinion. Some friends we were travelling with did dine there one night, and they gave it a thumbs-up, for the most part. A bit pricey, though, if you don't make the "Sunset Special" before 5:30 pm; meat entrees after that time will run you $22+ The 3:00 pm afternoon tea was a nice touch.. you can have hot or iced tea, and they serve crumpets and cookies as well, all complimentary. I'm an American, and personally, I'd take coffee and donuts any day over tea and crumpets, but what can you do..! Several nights a week they have a lady named Shirley Toms come to the Lobby to play some old-time piano tunes. My kids enjoyed this, and Shirley was very nice and included them in many of the songs. The hotel staff were very friendly, and for the most part, helpful. However, I should describe the situation we experienced; On two separate occasions we made calls down to the front desk with a request. The first time, we requested a small folding table for our room, if one was available. On a later day, we called down to the front desk to ask that a bottle opener be brought to our room. In both cases, we made repeated requests, and neither of our requests were met. It is not so much that the items we requested were not available; it is perfectly understandable if a hotel doesn't have specific items that might be requested such as those we requested. However, it is unacceptable that our requests were never answered definitively; nobody ever called to say that they didn't have available what we asked for.. there was simply no response at all. I was not impressed with that kind of service. The hotel is located right in the thick of things in Ocean City; there are many restaurants and activities within walking distance. Additionally, the Dunes Manor is right next to the start of the Ocean City Boardwalk. It was nice to be not quote ON the Boardwalk, but within walking distance of it. Unlike the uptown Hotels, you don't need to drive or take a bus to get to the boardwalk. All in All, the Dunes Manor Hotel was clean and friendly, and a great value for the money. I would most certainly consider staying there again; although I would probably do some further research of hotels in the area, to find one of comparable price and quality, but with a better pool / beachside pool area. However, if the Hotel pool is not of significant concern to you, the Dunes Manor is a Best Bet in Ocean City MD. If you have specific questions about this hotel that I have not already answered, please feel free to contact me at craigdg1@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent accomodations and friendly service. I traveled with my two daughters and felt very safe and secure at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “gross. gross. gross.”
Reviews.Author: helena1014
Reviews.Content: gross. i hate ocean city, but seeing the castle-like dunes manor hotel made a weekend trip there feel bearable. i was looking forward to some high class service and some luxurious rooming quarters because the outside of the place looks gorgeous! it stank, and when we checked in, the attendant at the front desk told us that he thought we might be set up at the dunes manor MOTEL next door. thank god we werent. we had the very top floor, which, in most hotels, is the very best. the balcony overlooked the ocean, which was nice, but it had no overhead, so when it rained, we stood outside there and got wet. the comforters and sheets were gross. the bathtub was yellowed with age (or from not being clean), and the sink was all stopped up. water pressure sucked. they had a microwave, fridge, and coffee maker, all from 1951. the "palacial" look was deceiving. in spring 2006, a hilton suites will be up running there. thank god. ocean city needs some serious revamping, and they need to add some high-end hotels to that area. its about time that people had other choices than rat-infested condos and nasty rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Love It!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stay at this hotel each year, usually in October. This year, we were there in March. Our stay has always been excellent. Especially love the "afternoon tea" every day!
